Are you at an early stage in your career seeking an opportunity in clean energy?Are you mid-career seeking a more fulfilling and mission-driven role to impact energy and environmental issues in support of the global energy transition?Do you have experience in utilities or engineering with an interest in energy policy?If so, then you may be a great fit to join the team at the International District Energy Association!The Organization: The International District Energy Association (IDEA) is a globally-recognized nonpartisan, nonprofit industry association, formed in 1909, that serves as an information/education hub and advocacy resource for the district energy industry. We organize high-quality conferences and trade shows, workshops and webinars to enable peer exchange and education, showcase best practices, and promote industry awareness. Our member organizations own, operate and optimize district energy systems in cities, on campuses, in communities, and provide technologies, innovations and services to support efficient, resilient district heating, district cooling, combined heat & power and microgrid systems.IDEA is a recognized and respected voice globally and interacts with and partners with other international, national, and regional governments and non-government organizations, such as US Department of Energy, USEnvironmental Protection Agency, United Nations Environment and the International Energy Agency. Learn more about our history and mission.Opportunities. As of November 2021, to support industry growth, and leverage opportunities in resilient energy infrastructure, we are seeking multiple professionals to join our team at our office near Boston. (For more details see here.) One key position would be principally focused on curating and managing education programs, conferences and webinars. A second position would center on policy, regulatory and energy industry issues including monitoring markets, legislative/policy matters and strategic partnerships. A third position would principally support technical, engineering and economic analyses, data-gathering, grant administration and industry-centered activities.Culture. IDEA functions as a small, tightknit team where people are enabled and empowered to perform a range of functions including events, education, communications, membership support and administration that often involve collaboration. We offer a friendly and supportive work environment, competitive salaries, robust benefits, and rewarding, mission-driven work with opportunities for growth and fulfillment. These are full-time employee (not independent contractor) positions.These positions report to the office in Westborough, MA with some remote flexibility, but candidates should be located or willing to relocate to greater Boston area. Occasional overnight travel (conference events) and international travel (post-pandemic) is to be expected, but is mostly scheduled well in advance. The positions will likely be defined as follows, but there may be some reconfiguring of duties based on the candidates’ strengths and skillsets.Technical/Industry Associate or Analyst Lead the investigation and reporting on member system efficiency and best practices including technical and economic evaluations.As required, provide engineering or environmental performance analyses to support policy development and advocacy; inform government and regulatory agencies, etcLeverage research activities to support advocacy for the district energy industry with global, federal, state and local governments and agencies and non-governmental organizations (NGO’s).Serve as principal author of reports or white papers or educational materials.Research energy data, facts, and project locations. Support drafting, designing, posting, and amplifying social media. Support development of press statements, policy advocacy letters and summaries.Form a strong understanding of organizational policy priorities, communications strategies, and brand to ensure that all external products remain on message.Support development of conference technical programs and assist Executive Editor of District Energy magazine from time to time.Participate in regular coalition calls and membership forums related to policy advocacy and communicationsSupport and manage incoming information or data requests or analyses as needed.Qualities and Capabilities of Ideal Candidates Strong analytical skills, excellent writing and communication skills are essential, along with ability to manage multiple responsibilities on a timely basis.Candidates should demonstrate a willingness to contribute to the overall success of the organization through a “can-do” attitude; able to work independently and as part of team; accomplish tasks with minimal supervision and see projects through to timely completion.Familiarity with district energy, CHP, microgrids, distributed generation, renewables and utility operations and regulations is helpful.Experience with natural gas and electric utilities, campus facilities, consulting engineering, mechanical/electrical engineering, and/or environmental policy/sustainability are a plus.IDEA seeks candidates with interest and passion for energy efficiency and environmental sustainability.We offer good potential for growth and visibility in a globally-expanding industry.Position will be awarded initially on a 3-month contract and then considered for extension after this time based on performance review. Title may change based on level of prior experience.Salary commensurate with experience. Generous fringe benefits include paid health and dental insurance; LT disability; term life insurance; eligible for 401K plus company match; paid vacation/ holidays.Located in Class A office space in suburban office in Westborough, MA. Professional, business casual atmosphere. Some remote work flexibility but duties require primary office presence. Flexible schedules and accommodating to periodic teleworking (when in-person work resumes)A current valid driver’s license and passport required. Occasional overnight or international travel can be expected post-pandemic, including conference events, which are scheduled 18-24 months in advance.Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) preferred; Master’s or advanced degrees are a plus.5-10 years prior professional experience in energy, utilities, engineering, or consulting is a plus.Candidates should be familiar and conversant on energy, utilities and environmental policy issues.Direct experience in district energy, CHP or microgrid sector is highly valued.Excellent writing, organizational, research, communications and administrative skills. Proficiency in all Microsoft Office products is essential.Experience in meetings/event planning could be a plus.HTML/web management proficiency is a bonus. Experience with standard website CMS interfaces; website development; HTML and related programming is helpful.Experience with Constant Contact (email marketing) and other social media - Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.Timing: We hope to fill these positions in 4Q 2021.Location: Our office is located in Westborough, MA in a quiet, treed suburban office park with on-campus health club (free and included), hiking and biking trails, free parking, cafeteria and recreation facilities. Positions are to report to IDEA office M-F 9 am – 5 pm “in-office” with some flexibility to work from home arrangements.How to apply: If interested in applying, please submit a cover letter, writing sample and resume. Cover letter should share relevant experience and why you should be considered for employment.Equal opportunity employer:  IDEA embraces a diversity of thought, culture, and background across our staff and broader professional community. We are an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and the needs of our organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, political ideology, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $60,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Westborough, MA 01581: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Data analysis skills: 5 years (Preferred)Energy Industry: 5 years (Preferred)Willingness to travel:25% (Preferred)Work Location: One location

When you join the team at HUB International, you become part of the 5th largest global insurance broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. Becoming a part of HUB means that you thrive in an entrepreneurial and fast paced team environment supported by over 14,000 professionals in 500 offices across North America. Summary

The Learning Management System Administrator is responsible for supporting the implementation of a new learning management system, including ongoing maintenance, reporting, and end-user support. The Learning Management System (LMS) Administrator will assist in assigning courses, running reports, and more. This position is responsible for the daily administration of the LMS and reports to the Director, HRIS. Preferred location is Chicago; Applicants in other locations will also be considered.

Major Duties & Responsibilities

Lead the implementation of the new LMS for HR and play a key leadership role in the additional phased roll out to the field in partnership with the Talent team

Provides support, troubleshooting, and the day to day administration of LMS once implemented to end users

Assists in transitioning courses to LMS platform

Uploads, tests and updates new learning objects into the LMS catalog from multiple formats

Generates standard reports, as requested, and assists with data analysis

Assists with assigning and registering users for training courses

Maintains data integrity rules and processes for the LMS such as course descriptions, course changes, assignment of course categories and course maintenance

Supports new approaches and policies to effect continual improvements in efficiency of the company

Helps create, manage and enforce LMS system standards, policies and procedures

Maintains user-based security

Performs other related HR duties as required and assigned

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred or an equivalent combination of education and experience

Minimum 2 years of experience working with Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD) LMS

Exceptional organizational and time management skills, and be proficient with applicable software systems

Excellent recording keeping and high attention to detail

Ability to interact and follow up effectively with employees and management at all levels

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Department Human Resources

Required Experience: 1-2 years of relevant experience

Required Travel: No Travel Required

Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

Job Description:
Carter's, Inc. is the largest branded marketer in North America of apparel exclusively for babies and young children. The Company owns the Carter's and OshKosh B'gosh brands, two of the most recognized brands in the marketplace. These brands are sold in leading department stores, national chains, and specialty retailers domestically and internationally. They are also sold through more than 1,000 Company-operated stores in the United States, Canada, and Mexico and online at www.carters.com, www.oshkosh.com, and www.cartersoshkosh.ca. The Company's Just One You and Genuine Kids brands are available at Target, its Child of Mine brand is available at Walmart, and its Simple Joys brand is available on Amazon. The Company also owns Skip Hop, a global lifestyle brand for families with young children. Carter's is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Additional information may be found at www.carters.com.
The Sales Audit Analyst is an important member of the Sales Audit & overall Retail Accounting team, responsible for owning all KPI reporting, and the corresponding data sets housed within the Aptos Sales Audit System as well as performing monthly reconciliations between Sales Audit interfacing systems, third party processors, and the general ledger.

This role partners cross-functionally with the Retail Accounting team, Assets Protection, IT, Omni-Channel, and other retail business leaders to create, deliver, analyze, and optimize key reports as well as reconcile between 4-6 general ledger accounts monthly. The ideal candidate for this position is highly motivated, data driven, has a working knowledge of basic accounting concepts, and enjoys taking initiative as a contributor in a highly collaborative team environment.

Reporting & Analysis - 60%Collect, analyze, and summarize data to proactively identify trends and inform business partners. Present metrics in an organized and understandable format to help make informed decisions. Create value-add of reports to meet business and leadership needs.
Track, analyze and interpret trends in data to provide relevant conclusions and recommendations to management. Significant emphasis will be placed on independent ownership and delivery of metric improvements by partnering with internal and external business partners to drive process efficiencies.
Validate and ensure the completeness and accuracy of reporting.
Drive the creation and managing of the reporting backlog to ensure integrity and correct prioritization based on business value, continuously engaging the key stakeholders’ concerns, requests, and input.
Provide insight on trends or unusual transaction activity that may impact financial close.
Provide ongoing and ad hoc analytical support to the Retail Leadership team.

Accounting & Reconciliation - 25%Support the fiscal closing calendar timelines for assigned tasks.
Monthly reconciliation of deferred revenue balance between Sales Audit, OMS, and the general ledger.
Lead the quarterly Deferred Revenue clean-up and reconciliation activities.
Reconciliation of credit card tenders between Sales Audit and third-party processor (Worldpay).
Reconciliation of in-store register and safe funds and booking of related journal entries.
Responsible for supporting the Carter’s Retail donation programs from an accounting and payment perspective.
Partnership with Operations, IT, Marketing, Call Center, Consumer Affairs, Accounts Payable, and Corporate Accounting.

Technical - 15%
Involved in testing various fixes and upgrades to the Sales Audit system and provide recommendations on areas for improvement to drive audit and reporting efficiencies.
Partner with IT to proactively drive improvements in system performance to support data analysis.
Required Experience:
Strong problem solver and highly analytical with proven ability to proactively leverage data to improve business operations.
Ability to perform data analysis, quantify results, and recommend appropriate action based upon conclusions.
Strong time management skills and the ability to work on multiple initiatives and reports under tight deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; strong Excel and general computer skills.
Self-motivated, organized, and effectively achieves team goals a must.
Ability to demonstrate independent, objective, open-minded thinking with strong attention to detail.
Bachelors degree in an appropriate field (BBA or BS preferred).
Minimum one year of experience reporting on and analyzing large sets of data.
Understanding of accounting principles.
Intermediate-level experience in Excel.
MSSQL Experience Preferred.
This role is based in our Buckhead office location

You will be helping to authenticate data that will be used in live online search tools and applications by millions of users across the world.Ideal Candidate: Candidates for this position will need to have good research skills and a strong understanding of local and national information. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.
The mission of TikTok Monetization Platform is to connect global advertisers, merchants, affiliates and users to get suitable marketing solutions and conversion funnels, to maximize conversion and monetization opportunities. Our vision is to build an easy-to-understand, easy-to-use and powerful platform for onsite commerce.

We are looking for data analysts to join the efforts driving monetization,

Apply expertise in data analysis and visualization to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our ads products.
Deliver data support for both short term and long term business development plans from strategic scope and execution aspects with in-depths analysis.
Work closely with key cross functional teams such as product managers, data science, and engineers to solve business problems.
Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of business products.
Bachelor's degree with a background in Math, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields;
Expert experience pulling large and complex data using SQL and writing data pipelines.
Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau);

Prefer to Have

Experience doing quantitative analysis;
Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.);
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills;
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop) a plus

Job Title: Quantitative Marketing Research Analyst, Brand Studio
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Social Science, Computer Science, a similar filed, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of dashboard experience (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Experience in data visualization and data management (e.g., R, Python, SQL, Google Cloud Platform, etc.).
Preferred qualifications:

Experience building customized dashboards that update automatically throughout the day.
Experience using datasets to create clear business stories (e.g., cadences, numerical/OpenText variables, big data, etc.).
Experience with social listening and other similar data (e.g., news data, online reviews, etc.) and survey data (e.g., brand/user tracking survey data).
Experience in statistical analysis (e.g., SPSS, R, Python, etc.).
About the job
As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large data sets and building expert systems that improve our understanding of the Web and improve the performance of our products. This effort includes performing complex statistical analysis on non-routine problems and working with engineers to embed models into production systems. You will manage fast changing business priorities and interface with product managers and engineers.

This role will be responsible for overseeing Google marketing's dashboards. The back-end infrastructure is used by teams at Google who build more customized dashboards for their particular roles.
In this role, you will maintain best practices for data visualization/infrastructure and optimize, streamline, and automate processes. You will work with survey research datasets and big data.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Manage multiple dashboards.
Collaborate with other teammates, manage stakeholder who use our dashboards and data pipelines, and manage agency partner relationships.
Create and maintain a dashboard for executive leadership.
Work with other dashboard and data pipeline experts on the team and throughout Google.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

·Job duties include (but are not limited to): · We are currently looking for a data analyst who is eager to gain experience in the defense contracting industry. The data analyst will work alongside multiple departments in the client’s organization, the Air Force Culture and Language Center (AFCLC), which assists Airmen in language learning and cultural competency development. This position provides a unique opportunity to develop and utilize data analytics skills while working in a consulting role.Job Duties: · Performing deep dives into data using hypothesis testing and exploratory data analysis and presenting findings to Director of the AFCLC and other decision-makers within the center· Analyzing quarterly data for multiple departments within the AFCLC and presenting findings to clients on a quarterly basis· Analyzing quiz and test results for two separate biannual culture courses offered by the AFCLC· Creating, updating, and sending out surveys using Qualtrics and analyzing responses· Updating existing automated analysis and reporting as needed using Python and Jupyter Notebook for various quarterly reports, culture course analyses, and deep divesNecessary Skills, Technologies, and Requirements: · US Citizenship (required)· Proven experience (minimum of one year) in applying Python and Python’s data science libraries including NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, Matplotlib, and Seaborn to data science and analytics projects· Fundamental knowledge of statistics and various metrics and variables needed for data analysis including mean, median, standard deviation, variance, covariance, p-value, etc.· Demonstrated experience utilizing Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) to handle data, derive findings, create visualizations, write reports, and present to clients· Ability to transform data to insights and insights to data-driven decisions by presenting findings to key decision makersPreferred Qualifications (not required)· Prior experience in military or working for a defense contractor· Secret Clearance but not required· Experience designing, updating, and sending surveys using Qualtrics· Understanding of hypothesis tests (t-tests, ANOVA tests, Chi-Squared tests etc.) and how and when to apply them· Understanding of machine learning algorithms (linear regression, logistic regression, KNN, etc.) and ability to identify ways to apply machine learning to various applicationsJob Type: Full-timePay: $45.00 - $48.50 per hourBenefits:Dental insuranceEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Millbrook, AL 36054: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Experience:Python: 2 years (Required)t-tests, ANOVA tests, Chi-squared: 2 years (Preferred)Security clearance:Secret (Preferred)Work Location: One location

The Sales Operations department is looking for a talented, motivated Business Analyst to add to our Business Control team. This role will be responsible for core sales operations artifacts related to GHX business verticals and will report to the Manager, Sales Operations. This role is responsible for coordination of data related to monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting for the GHX sales team & leadership.

Functions include collecting, analyzing, evaluating, and reporting on the business results stemming from sales, renewals, and any other related commercial efforts. The Business Analyst will perform ad hoc data analysis, provide data insights, and manage special projects as needed.

This role will be managing datasets which will be expected to identify improvements in productivity, efficiency, effectiveness, and organization of the sales team(s). This role will also identify gaps in data needs or reporting and will be responsible to resolve those issues as sustainably as possible. This role will often need to coordinate interdepartmental dependencies, providing analytical support for technical and business activity planning and helping drive repeatable processes into the GHX operating model.

Key Responsibilities
Participate directly in month-end bookings reconciliation process and publishing actual bookings results to include analysis of actuals to forecast variances
Tracks and reports on key sales metrics, evaluates sales performance measured against sales goals; distributes results to sales management in a timely manner
Assist team with detailed deal tracking, forecasting, review, and analysis
Provides data analysis, organizes, and filters data to report monthly commissions to appropriate stakeholders
Develops, coordinates and facilitates professional relationships with internal and external subject matter experts and cross functional stakeholders
Seeks to develop process improvement both within their work product but also cross-functionally on processes that the sales function views as dependencies
Key Duties
Maintains rep scorecards and rankings related to quota and territory performance

GHX: It's the way you do business in healthcare

Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX) enables better patient care and billions in savings for the healthcare community by maximizing automation, efficiency and accuracy of business processes.

GHX is a healthcare business and data automation company, empowering healthcare organizations to enable better patient care and maximize industry savings using our world class cloud-based supply chain technology exchange platform, solutions, analytics and services. We bring together healthcare providers and manufacturers and distributors in North America and Europe - who rely on smart, secure healthcare-focused technology and comprehensive data to automate their business processes and make more informed decisions.

It is our passion and vision for a more operationally efficient healthcare supply chain, helping organizations reduce - not shift - the cost of doing business, paving the way to delivering patient care more effectively. Together we take more than a billion dollars out of the cost of delivering healthcare every year. GHX is privately owned, operates in the United States, Canada and Europe, and employs more than 800 people worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is in Louisville, Colorado, just outside of Denver, with additional offices in Europe, Chicago, Illinois, and Omaha, Nebraska.

At Propel, our mission is to build modern, respectful, and effective financial tools for low-income Americans. Over 5 million people use our app, Providers, to manage the benefits they use to keep their family well-fed and healthy, stay up to date on critical government programs, save money and earn income. Read more about the impact of Providers (previously called Fresh EBT here, here, and here.) Now we've expanded further into the financial services space, offering the best banking option for low-income Americans.

Propel is a for-profit software company that holds its social mission at its core. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, Kleiner Perkins, Kevin Durant, Serena Williams, and Nas. We are strongly committed to hiring a diverse and multicultural team. We encourage applications from traditionally under-represented backgrounds, including those with direct experience with the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program or other government benefits.

As a Rotational Analyst, you'll engage in two six-month rotations, followed by placement in a permanent role. Potential rotations include opportunities like working with our business team to implement the right content to show our millions of users, working with our government team to get Propel's data in front of policymakers, and working with our debit operations team to ensure that our users have access to their money when they need it - all work that is central to Propel's mission. Our first Rotational Analyst cohort will begin on January 31, 2022.

We are strongly committed to hiring a diverse and multicultural team. We encourage applications from traditionally under-represented backgrounds, including those with direct experience with the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.

We offer:

Immediate opportunity to make an impact - you'll take on significant business and client responsibility from day one
Investment in your professional growth by placing you in rotations focused on your learning and skill development
A dedicated mentor from Propel's executive team
A salary of $80,000
A get-stuff-done and fun and caring culture
Meaningful work and a strong shared sense of mission
Competitive compensation (including equity) and excellent benefits

The right person for this program:

Is passionate about contributing to Propel mission of serving Americans with low income
Experienced with Excel and data analysis; experience with SQL, R, Python, HTML/CSS a plus
Embraces new technical challenges, and is eager to learn (by doing!) in a startup environment
Has excelled working in an unstructured environment where the guidelines weren't always clear. This could be startup work experience, a side project you worked on outside of school/work, or volunteer or academic work that was primarily self-directed
Demonstrates incredible attention to detail
Communicates clearly and concisely
Brings a perspective, background, or experience that makes Propel more diverse

Onboarding Aviation Analyst
Why We Need You – The Mission

At ATP we develop, and regularly enhance, the advanced technology that runs the maintenance tracking, inventory management, and flight operations tools for flight departments across the globe. Our products alleviate flight disrupters and add control and efficiency to the process, so flight departments can safely accept as many missions as possible.

We are looking for motivated, hard-working Onboarding Aviation Analysts (OAA) to be responsible for the successful onboarding of new aircraft onto the Flightdocs system using various types of aircraft maintenance compliance documentation. This position requires customer engagement in order to verify and/or request additional information as necessary as well as data analysis of extensive, complex data sets. Thorough auditing and review of information is required to verify the accuracy of records.

The ideal candidate will have a proven ability to learn quickly, be extremely deadline driven and thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. This individual should be solutions driven and be comfortable identifying problems and solving them with urgency.

What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives
Objective #1
In your first thirty days, develop an understanding of the Enterprise maintenance system, onboarding tools, the customers and the current projects Demo and become a competent user of Flightdocs Enterprise.
 Begin familiarizing with the onboarding terminology, abbreviations, etc. Utilize and update Salesforce to track the onboarding process for each client and each aircraft.
 Within your first 30 days, successfully complete the onboarding of at least one aircraft per week while maintain an average accuracy of 90%+.

Objective #2
In your first sixty days, onboard new and increasing variety of aircraft types Aircraft being assigned will be different make/model and from different vendors. Identify discrepancies in the data sets provided against manufacture requirements. Maintain an average accuracy of 90-95%.

Objective #3
In your first 90 days, gain efficiency and onboard more complex aircraft types Expand your knowledge into different enrollment types and their difficulty levels Gain and grow extensive knowledge of a wide variety of aircraft technical publications and aircraft maintenance requirements.
 Maintain an average accuracy of 97% or higher.

Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That Matter

Strong Problem Solvers/Analytical Thinkers: The right person for this job has strong problem-solving skills and data analysis abilities. They will be able to verify usability and completeness of documentation provided, ensuring it meets current standards to enroll the aircraft properly. They will be able to analyze customer maintenance programs to identify discrepancies amongst extensive, complex data sets. Including identifying, analyzing and interpreting trends and/or patterns.

Project Management, Organizational Planning & Execution: The best OAA will have excellent project and time management skills. They will do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks and deadlines at once, with a seamless path of prioritizing their schedule. The OAA will be responsible for maintaining their own queue, so they must excel at planning, executing and closing all projects on or before deadlines.

Personality & Interpersonal Skills: Success in this role requires emotional agility. The OAA must be able to work well with a wide variety of personalities and roles. They need to be able to clearly communicate with customers of various backgrounds to effectively deliver information pertaining to their maintenance tracking and customer expectations. They must thrive working in a high-volume, demanding environment with a wide variety of projects and a growing customer base.
They have a collaborative mindset and drive to work well with team members from all departments and contribute to reaching shared goals. This candidate should be comfortable monitoring current processes and utilizing tools; be innovative and communicate externally and internally to enhance current and future integrations and improvements to the team.

How we work - Our Core Values

We are at our best when we:
are selfless team players. We work together to achieve our goals and we put the team ahead of ourselves.are driven to succeed exceed. We take pride in our work and in exceeding expectations.find a better way. By seeking to understand the challenge, we work to improve the process and solution.are simplifiers (not complicators). We focus on solutions and not obstacles. We take action and ownership. We gather the right people in the room and drive to a solution.

Job Title: Quantitative Analyst (Charlotte, NC or Fully Remote)
Description:
Work Location:
Charlotte, NC (hybrid) or Fully Remote: To protect the health and safety of our employees, our offices are closed. When our offices reopen, the organization will be moving to a hybrid work model.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
At Brighthouse Financial, we’re fostering a culture where diverse backgrounds and experiences are celebrated, and different ideas are heard and respected. We believe that by creating an inclusive workplace, we’re better able to attract and retain our talent, provide valuable solutions that meet the needs of our advisors and their clients, and deliver on our mission of helping more people achieve financial security.

How This Role Contributes to Brighthouse Financial:
This Quantitative Analyst role is in the Variable Annuities Asset and Liability Management (VA ALM) department reporting to the Leader of the Quantitative Research Strategy. The VA ALM is a critical function within the ﬁrm that impacts multiple other business units such as Risk, Accounting, Trading, Valuation, Pricing and Planning. Within the VA ALM department, the Quantitative Research Strategy team is the center for development and recommendation of hedge strategies, portfolio optimization, creation of new analytic capabilities and various models.

Key Responsibilities:
Work closely with production groups to understand and meet business needs through the appropriate design, prototyping of analytics and calibration of models
Measure, monitor, and perform research on methods to minimize portfolio tracking error
Investigate methods to replicate fund performance based on style analysis and tradeable indices
Assist in the evolution of existing models to meet changing needs by drafting documentation, performing model validation, and identifying areas for improvement
Research and explain equity and interest rate derivatives mathematics
Produce high quality documentation of our models and methods
Additional duties as assigned

Essential Business Experience and Technical Skills:
A degree in a technical or quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, physics, or computer science with strong academic record, demonstrated analytical problem-solving skill and experience tackling in-depth research projects
Course work in several of the following areas: PDEs, time-series analysis, statistical estimation, Monte Carlo methods, Bayesian techniques, risk factor models, linear/non-linear programming and optimal control, general machine learning methods
Advanced programming skill in Python and knowledge of SQL. Experience with Scala, C++, or MATLAB is desirable
Desirable attributes: solid organizational skill, creativity, strong communication skills, attention to detail, innate curiosity and resourcefulness
Speciﬁc experience with stochastic simulation: a variety of interest rate, equity, and exchange rate processes and volatility models, real world implementation considerations
Also desirable: knowledge of or experience with
Numerix tools
High-performance, multi-threaded, application development
Predictive analytics, state space models, long horizon regression, and structural multivariate models
Machine learning techniques, including deep neural nets and reinforcement learning
Dynamic asset allocation strategies used in the industry risk and portfolio analysis systems used by asset managers
Modern data science tools such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or MXNet
Working with a trading desk
Although industry knowledge or experience is preferred, we will consider candidates without a background in ﬁnance and familiarity with academic ﬁnance literature

Compensation and Benefits:
Compensation: Base salary ranging from $80,000 to $100,000 plus competitive performance-based incentives determined by company and individual results
Time Off: Minimum of 20 days of paid time off and 13 paid company holidays per full calendar year, plus paid volunteer time
Financial Benefits: 401(k) savings plan with up to a 6% annual match and 3% annual company nondiscretionary contribution of eligible compensation, and employee stock purchase plan
Family Focus: Up to 16 weeks of paid leave for new parents, back-up care program, dependent care flexible spending account, and adoption and surrogacy assistance
Health and Welfare: Competitive medical, vision and dental plans, plus tax-free health savings accounts with potential company contributions up to $1,000 per family
Wellness Programs: Wellness incentive platform, employee assistance program, financial counseling services, fitness center discounts and more
Life & Disability Benefits: Company-paid basic life insurance and short-term disability

Travel:
Up to 10%

ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF)
The role will focus on ensuring KeyBank’s models (e.g. consumer scoring, Fraud, Market Risk, Marketing, Treasury, etc.) continue to perform as intended and perform effectively for their use and meet KeyBank’s standards. This requires a blend of a technical skill set (coding, modeling/analytics) and an attention to detail. The role evaluates ongoing performance monitoring, data quality controls, and emerging risks that may create model risk. In addition, the role will also be involved with additional responsibilities to explore emerging industry practices such as automation and orchestration in cloud environments.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Understand the conceptual/technical framework, assumptions, limitation of models, quantitative methods, analytics, machine learning algorithms, and how those are used in the business decision-making process
Vet and verify implementation of models to ensure intended use
Assess adequacy of monitoring, maintenance, and documentation of models and quantitative methods.
Understand and assess control environment a model is operated under and opine on the effectiveness of controls.
Identify and escalate risks and issues identified, and effectively document the testing and conclusions.
Partner effectively with stakeholders (business line users, model developers, and management) to communicate risks and issues identified.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s or Master’s (or its equivalent) in statistics, mathematics, economics, financial engineering, data sciences, predictive modeling, or other quantitative disciplines and 0-1 years of relevant experience;
0-1 years of industry experience in model development or validation or quantitative models and methods, or other comparable experience
Prior knowledge of one of the following scientific computing / statistical programming languages (e.g. Python, R, SAS). Preferred experience in Cloud environment (e.g. Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, etc) and machine learning models/methods
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously to meet strict deadlines
Ability to work independently and in a team environment in collaboration with other team members and external consulting firms
Key has implemented a role-based Mobile by Design approach to our employee workspaces, dedicating space to those whose roles require specific workspaces, while providing flexible options for roles which are less dependent on assigned workspaces and can be performed effectively in a mobile environment. As a result, this role may be mobile or home based, which means you may work either at a home office or in a Key facility to perform your job duties. #LI-REMOTE
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
This position is eligible to earn a base salary in the range of $53,800 to $99,800 annually depending on job-related factors such as level of experience. Compensation for this role also includes eligibility for short-term incentive compensation and deferred incentive compensation subject to individual and company performance. Location: Remote, East Coast
The Inventory Control Analyst will work with distribution teams, as well as cross functional stakeholders in the organization, to create dashboards, tools, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that describe inventory trends within the organization. They will also lead efforts and drive strategic projects directly related to improving these KPIs. This role requires you to acquire deep subject matter knowledge about systems, distribution, and fulfillment processes and KPIs used to manage and drive the business. It is essential that you can think strategically, connect the dots in the bigger picture, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables to drive operational improvements. The role is expected to simultaneously handle multiple projects of department-level scale and global reach.
Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to ensure that they are accurate and timely (from and to all external and/or internal operations)
Develop and supply strategic reporting to the Operations team, including: quarterly summaries, monthly trends, week-over-week analysis, and daily reporting
Develop trend reporting on top inventory offenders in all functions of the warehouse for inaccuracies to help operations leadership in seeking to understand root causes
Innovate and maintain cycle count programs in a perpetual inventory environment at all sites globally
Perform thorough research and documentation on inventory discrepancies (to identify root causes and supply possible solutions)
Develop and drive departmental and organizational goals through data analysis with the ability to speak to multiple levels of the business
Take a high level of ownership of site training and team development based around inventory, with the goal of preventing inaccuracies
Daily reporting on variance trends on site including top offenders by username per function, top bins with discrepancies, top pick zones with errors, and any additional root cause investigations
Consolidate quarterly, monthly, and weekly summaries of inventory adjustments, including: inventory discrepancies, write offs, variances, and overall value trends.
Identify process and system gaps, and highlight areas for optimization/automation with the goal of driving projects to improve these areas.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, Analytics, or Industrial Engineering (or relevant experience)
Preferred: 2+ years work experience in finance, supply chain, operations, or inventory control/management
Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project
Advanced skills using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus

Who we are
We are the CX Digital Experiences (DX) team, and we're on a mission to address the evolving expectations of today's connected consumers. Using real-time connected data, machine learning, and automation – coupled with robust customer listening – the team enables Cisco and its partners to deliver a powerful, personalized experience — throughout the entire customer lifecycle.
We're looking for a curious and collaborative Quantitative Researcher & Analyst who is passionate about solving customer and business problems. As a Quantitative Researcher & Analyst, this person will be responsible for investigating user behaviors and needs using empirical research methods. You will also organize, and present data extracted from disparate tools, applications, and systems, providing business planning assistance, periodic measurements of effectiveness, and facilitate efforts to optimize operational efficiency. This role will be involved in advancing research and a customer-centric approach within a growing organization and help craft the future of Cisco’s customer experience. What you’ll do: Conduct full-cycle research projects, from framing research questions to analyzing data to sharing insights Employ a variety of research methodologies, including conducting original surveys and analyzing behavioral data Turn the patterns you find in data into key insights and powerful narratives Perform multi-channel customer feedback analysis to identify areas of improvement for customer experience Develop presentations to summarize key findings, effectively communicate insights to internal stakeholders Establish partnerships with Data Science and Metrics & Analytics teams Develop processes and methods for acquiring new data sources to enrich analytical data Handle on-going maintenance and updates of customer-related data attributes Identify process bottlenecks and inconsistencies Collaborate across researchers to ensure data collection through research efforts are reliable and accurate Validate data integrity and quality of all inputs; identify data gaps, propose fixes, and handle resolution Develop relevant dashboards to highlight key findings for customer insights projects and team metrics What you'll bring: Bachelor’s or equivalent work experience 5+ years of experience Expertise in quantitative methods, including data collection and analysis Experience conducting statistical analyses as well as proficiency in SQL Experience working with diverse datasets, including both structured and unstructured, and behavioral and self-reported Incredible attention to detail and commitment to quality. Consistently deliver thoughtful, high-quality output Strong verbal, written and visual communication skills A learner’s approach, sees feedback as a chance to grow Familiarity with research software such as Qualtrics, Verint, User Testing and Miro (or similar) Experience in a B2B organization, SaaS experience a plus
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Why Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns, and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take the difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world-changing? Be you, with us! We Are Cisco CPXE

You are extremely organized and possess high attention to detail
You have a strong work ethic

You can quickly adapt to new processes and procedures as our team grows and our processes rapidly improve
You are excited to learn about our current processes and infrastructure, and willing to provide creative suggestions to improve our workflow as you grow in your role

Please note division and function examples are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business need. Specific roles will be confirmed through the interview process.
Investment Banking Division works on some of the most complex financial challenges and transactions in the market today. Whether advising on a merger, providing financial solutions for an acquisition, or structuring an initial public offering, we handle projects that help clients at major milestones. We work with corporations, pension funds, financial sponsors, and governments and are team of strong analytical thinkers, who have a passion for producing out-of-the-box ideas.
Financing Group Coverage Banking sits within a dynamic, market-driven environment, our teams work closely with corporate clients, pension funds, financial sponsors and governments to structure and execute some of the largest and most complex financing and risk management solutions across the full product spectrum, including equity, debt and derivatives. To achieve this goal, the Financing Group comprises all Goldman Sachs’ capital markets departments, and operates on close cooperation with other areas of Investment Banking and other divisions within the firm, including Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities and Equities.
Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) within Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) is responsible for managing client assets, and is a market leader in quantitative portfolio management. We use advanced quantitative methods to structure, manage, and monitor investment portfolios including hedge funds, mutual funds, and separately managed account. QIS offers multi-asset strategies, as well as equity strategies, including both actively managed portfolios and portfolios that closely track an index. Clients include public, corporate and charitable institutions, high net-worth individuals, retail investors, and various portfolio management groups within the division. Members of QIS work closely together in teams of junior and senior professionals, providing a unique environment for outstanding candidates to learn and apply advanced financial and econometric methods to all aspects of the investment process.
Global Markets Division enables our clients to buy and sell financial products, raise funding and manage risk. We make markets and facilitate client transactions in fixed income, equity, currency and commodity products. In addition, we make markets in and clear client transactions on major stock, options and futures exchanges worldwide. Through our global sales force, we maintain relationships with our clients, receiving orders and distributing investment research, trading ideas, market information and analysis.
Equities teams transact in stocks and other equity-related products, including convertible securities, options, and futures. Their work includes financing, securities lending, and other services for institutional investors.
Fixed Income, Currency, and Commodities teams transact in a variety of assets, including interest rate products (such as government bonds, treasury bills, and other highly liquid instruments), credit products, mortgages, currencies, and commodities
Corporate Treasury is tasked with finding the best ways for Goldman Sachs to deploy its financial resources within the parameters of regulatory guidelines as well as the firm’s own risk appetite. The Treasury function plays a key role in the management of the firm’s liquidity, funding, capital, and allocation of financial resources to align with the firm’s overall strategy and to ensure the firm is resilient in its ability to carry out its activities. Treasury teams are strategically focused, have a collaborative nature and possess strong problem solving skills.
Treasury Execution Services focuses on asset liability management execution including liability issuance and hedging, interest rate and currency hedging, as well as capital execution. The team manages the firm’s excess liquidity portfolio including cash and collateral management.
Private Wealth Management (PWM) secures, develops and manages relationships with high net worth individuals, their families, family offices and foundations. We have specialized teams as detailed below, who partner with advisors to create solutions for clients.
Investment Strategy Group is an independent team of global investment professionals that provides guidance on asset allocation and portfolio diversification. ISG delivers objective, strategic and tactical investment advice, including helping clients determine their optimal strategic asset allocation, generating tactical investments ideas and strategies to implement these views.
Market Solutions Group offers customized advisory, structuring, and execution services across asset classes to high net worth individuals, family offices and select institutions. With investment specialists actively engaged in public and private markets globally, MSG provides strategic and tactical advice spanning global capital markets including equities, fixed income, currencies, commodities, and interest rates. MSG offers separately managed accounts including equity derivatives and structured investment strategies for client portfolios. MSG also provides capital markets experience and access to unique investment opportunities to clients
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (2017 – December 2020)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Commercially savvy with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.


We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Location: Remote, East Coast
The Inventory Control Analyst will work with distribution teams, as well as cross functional stakeholders in the organization, to create dashboards, tools, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that describe inventory trends within the organization. They will also lead efforts and drive strategic projects directly related to improving these KPIs. This role requires you to acquire deep subject matter knowledge about systems, distribution, and fulfillment processes and KPIs used to manage and drive the business. It is essential that you can think strategically, connect the dots in the bigger picture, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables to drive operational improvements. The role is expected to simultaneously handle multiple projects of department-level scale and global reach.
Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to ensure that they are accurate and timely (from and to all external and/or internal operations)
Develop and supply strategic reporting to the Operations team, including: quarterly summaries, monthly trends, week-over-week analysis, and daily reporting
Develop trend reporting on top inventory offenders in all functions of the warehouse for inaccuracies to help operations leadership in seeking to understand root causes
Innovate and maintain cycle count programs in a perpetual inventory environment at all sites globally
Perform thorough research and documentation on inventory discrepancies (to identify root causes and supply possible solutions)
Develop and drive departmental and organizational goals through data analysis with the ability to speak to multiple levels of the business
Take a high level of ownership of site training and team development based around inventory, with the goal of preventing inaccuracies
Daily reporting on variance trends on site including top offenders by username per function, top bins with discrepancies, top pick zones with errors, and any additional root cause investigations
Consolidate quarterly, monthly, and weekly summaries of inventory adjustments, including: inventory discrepancies, write offs, variances, and overall value trends.
Identify process and system gaps, and highlight areas for optimization/automation with the goal of driving projects to improve these areas.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, Analytics, or Industrial Engineering (or relevant experience)
Preferred: 2+ years work experience in finance, supply chain, operations, or inventory control/management
Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project
Advanced skills using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus

Job Title: Financial Advisory Entry-Level Analyst Program Career Opport...
Description:
PFM is a recognized national leader in providing financial, investment, and consulting advice to public sector, non-profit and other institutional entities. For more than forty years, PFM has advised many of the country’s largest municipal and institutional entities including states, counties, municipalities, townships, boroughs, authorities, school districts, not-for-profit organizations, and pension funds. The firm has more than 650 employees located in every region of the country.


It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they are doing!
PFM is a recognized national leader in providing financial, investment, and consulting advice to public sector, non-profit and other institutional entities. For more than forty years, PFM has advised many of the country’s largest municipal and institutional entities including states, counties, municipalities, townships, boroughs, authorities, school districts, not-for-profit organizations, and pension funds. The firm has more than 650 employees located in every region of the country.
PFM is proud to help our clients make well-informed and prudent decisions regarding the capital markets, investments, and municipal management. The functions that they serve and decisions that they make contribute directly to the communities in which we all live and work. PFM’s role with our clients allows us to have a tangible impact on these communities and their citizenry.

Financial Advisor Services: PFM Financial Advisors LLC plays an integral role in the capital formation process for municipal and not-for-profit bond issuers. PFM’s financial advisors contribute across all phases of the debt financing process, providing independent and expert advice to best position our clients to meet their short- and long-term goals and objectives.

PFM’S FOUNDATION FOR SUCCESS
PFM’s Analysts are a critical part of the project teams that serve our broad base of clients. Each role provides a solid foundation for a meaningful and growth-oriented career within the firm, and many of our project managers and Managing Directors started their careers with PFM.
As you transition to Analyst, PFM offers one of the most comprehensive training programs in the financial industry. In 10-12 weeks of intense training, Analysts learn the financial, analytical, and modeling skills needed to thrive in their roles.
Your career with PFM can grow based on your unique strengths, interests, and the firm’s ongoing needs. No matter the path you choose, you’ll receive an exceptional foundation of training, a collaborative and challenging work culture, and meaningful work that generates tangible benefits to the communities that PFM serves.

Responsibilities:
Your day to day challenges include:
Quantitative Analysis and Financial Modeling : Working with senior team members to create qualitative and quantitative analyses that support various projects and transactions, many of which involve the creation and use of customized financial models and spreadsheets.
Presentations and Reporting : Preparing and delivering presentations, reports and summaries that outline financial scenarios and recommendations to clients.
Marketing and Business Development Support : Contributing to and reviewing financial, legal, and marketing/proposal documents for all transactions and projects to which you are assigned.
Client Service Exposure : Gaining direct and meaningful exposure to a broad variety of clients and transactions across all of the entities that PFM serves.

Qualifications:
WHAT IT TAKES TO SUCCEED AT PFM
We are seeking Analysts to start with PFM in our Winter 2022 Analyst class, beginning in January 2022 and our Summer 2022 Analyst class, beginning in July 2022. Recent graduates, upcoming graduates, and qualified candidates with related post-graduate experience are all encouraged to apply.
Successful candidates come from a wide variety of academic disciplines and backgrounds and have an inherent passion for public service. AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply for employment with PFM.
Key attributes PFM seeks include:
Bachelor's degree (minimum GPA of 3.25)
Strong interest in finance, consulting and/or investment management
Analytical and financial modeling experience - advanced Excel skills and VBA or programming exposure are a plus
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Strong work ethic with a proactive, flexible attitude and a desire to pitch in wherever needed
Developed problem solving skills and a solutions-focused approach to addressing challenges
Ability to dig into the details but also see the greater context behind your work
Outstanding teamwork and project execution skills with multitasking capability
Unwavering integrity and ethics
In addition to training, PFM Analysts are eligible to receive a robust total rewards package including:
Compensation - base salary, sign-on bonus opportunity, annual opportunities for performance-based increases
Health and wellness benefits and disability and life insurance
Retirement benefits - 401k with employer match, and annual profit-sharing opportunity
Ongoing learning and developmental opportunities , including professional development assistance and tuition reimbursement
Work/life benefits – a challenging, diverse, and collaborative work environment, flexible paid time off, a formal mentorship program, volunteer opportunities, and much more

Relocation Assistance - relocation assistance available
TO APPLY
If you’re ready to experience the challenge, satisfaction, and reward of an opportunity with PFM, please apply here, or refer a qualified candidate.
If you are ready to experience the challenge, satisfaction, and reward of an opportunity with PFM, please apply here, or refer a qualified candidate.

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.

Our team uses data analysis to help drive the company’s monetization strategy and operations. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst to drive analytics initiatives that guide operational excellence for our Americas business. You will have a ground floor opportunity to shape TikTok’s growth and monetization efforts in Americas.

In this role, you will:

Collect, process, and clean data from disparate sources using SQL, Python, and BI tools to investigate key business trends, issues and opportunities
Develop scalable analytical solutions such as tables, datasets, models and dashboards
Conduct Ad-hoc analysis that helps the business better understand key value drivers and growth opportunities
Effectively communicate actionable insights across all levels to inform monetization efforts
Work closely with cross-functional partners, including local monetization teams, sales & sales operations, international strategy and data teams to drive analytical initiatives to completion
Pursuing a BA/BS degree in math, statistics, data science, business analytics, engineering, computer science or other quantitative major
Solid analytical aptitude with strong exposure or interest in strategy
Strong programming (SQL, Python, R etc) and statistical modeling skills
Expertise in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker is a plus
Self-starter attitude: You’re someone who can initiate and drive complex analysis to completion with minimal guidance and then synthesize and communicate insights
Get-it-done mindset: You’re motivated to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

About Us:

New datasets are being created every day and companies need to incorporate them to remain competitive.

YipitData is the go-to, 200+ person data team for hundreds of the largest institutional investors and corporations in the world. We identify, screen, license, clean, and analyze alternative data to help clients answer their key questions.

We have amazing reviews (and a 5-star rating!) on Glassdoor and are one of Inc's Best Workplaces - a fast-growing technology company based in NYC, backed by Norwest Venture Partners and with a strong culture focused on mastery, ownership, and purpose.

About The Role:

In 2019 YipitData launched a new business unit providing alternative data insights to corporations. Our Corporate business is growing quickly and we are expanding our data team by hiring a Junior Data Analyst (Official Title: "Associate Data Consultant") who will be key to the success of the initiative.

This is a fantastic opportunity for candidates with 1-2 years of experience as you will support building our Corporate business from the ground up and develop the core skills required to succeed at the intersection of tech, data, and client-facing work.

This is a remote-friendly opportunity that can sit in NYC (where our headquarter is located), or anywhere in the US.

US work authorization is required for this position.

In this role, you'll gain experience in:

Programming and data: learn (or sharpen) big data analysis skills, develop compelling data-driven analyses, and present to clients and prospects
Learn and master Python, SQL, Pyspark, Tableau, Databricks, Airflow, and other key big data analysis tools
New product development: this early stage initiative gives you a unique chance to collaborate on product discovery, identify and empathize with customer pain points, and help clients get value from our insights products
Sales and client strategy: on a given day, you might help brainstorm product positioning or develop a new analysis to answer a prospect's question, all while ensuring an amazing experience in supporting our existing clients

You are likely to succeed if:

You have 1-2 years of experience in an analytical role within an existing product team, management consulting firm, large Financial Services institution, economic consulting firm, at a data provider, or at a software company
You have an entrepreneurial spirit and are excited to help build a new business from the ground up
You are willing to persevere through the highs and lows of creating something new
You are a methodical problem solver
You have a commitment to learning to code and/or honing your existing coding skills
You have an ability to manage many different priorities
You are both a self-starter and a collaborative and considerate a team player

Meet Your Team:

Check out this video to learn why our Corporate team members love being part of YipitData!

What We Offer:

Our compensation package includes equity and highly competitive salary
We care about your personal life and we mean it. We offer flexible work hours, unlimited vacation, generous 401K match and parental leave policy, team bonding events, a wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more!
Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust. To learn more about our culture and values, check out our Glassdoor page!

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 73 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.
As a Crypto Analyst and Writer on the Crypto Intelligence team, you will be conducting research to gather, analyze and synthesize intelligence about crypto projects and initiatives across the crypto asset ecosystem. You will serve as a subject matter expert on the crypto initiatives you cover, and will work with cross-functional teams (e.g., legal, compliance) to provide them with the knowledge and insights necessary to provide our crypto partners with the best experience possible. In addition, you will be responsible for creating documentation that can help internal and external constituents understand complex subjects in ways that are easy to understand and remember.

What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):
Conduct due diligence on crypto projects, including directly liaising with asset issuers. Write internal reports that synthesize your learnings, working cross-functionally to educate various teams on all elements of the projects and program.
In addition to writing internal reports, own and manage documentation on crypto projects and initiatives, to empower internal cross-functional teams and external constituents who have a need to easily and quickly understand complex matters.
Manage the rigor of day-to-day operations with energy, enthusiasm, empathy towards colleagues, and a strong bias for action.
Liaise with cross-functional teams (such as Legal, Compliance, and Information Security) to conduct research and due diligence on crypto assets. Help identify emerging trends, risks, blockers and flags to relevant internal stakeholders.
Stay informed of news, forks, governance, and other major events associated with assets supported on Coinbase platforms.
Partner with external stakeholders such as law firms, researchers, security auditors, and asset issuing teams to help prioritize, review, and launch new assets.
Build and maintain internal tools (including spreadsheets) to track information about different assets.
Prioritize competing tasks and deadlines, using data driven decision making.
Serve as the subject matter expert for crypto assets, and coordinate Q&A/FAQs across various internal teams and external parties.
What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
2+ years of total experience working in project management, customer support/success, account management, or similar roles.
5+ years experience in technical and/or non-technical writing for use cases such as training, customer support/education, blog posts, and knowledge center articles, for fast-paced, fast-changing companies/industries.
Startup experience, with demonstrated ability to move fast while maintaining an excellent quality bar.
Experience building and maintaining spreadsheets, and performing basic data analysis.
Exceptional prioritization and project management skills.
Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; great listener with the ability to concisely synthesize complex issues. Ability to translate complex information effectively across the organization to compliance, legal, engineering, and executives
Have a positive attitude, motivate your team, and drive projects to completion through influence, through shifting priorities and deadlines.
Strategic thinking and an ability to synthesize and prioritize inputs from various perspectives (including legal, finance, business, engineering, and customer experience) to create actionable improvements.
Metrics orientation, ability to work with data and willingness to track results, activities and manage third party vendors and relationships.
Strong entrepreneurial skills, speed, initiative, and ability to pierce through obstacles no matter what is thrown in front of you.
Excellence in making informed judgements, setting priorities in ambiguous situations, and driving projects to completion while maintaining outstanding quality.
Ability to collaborate with teammates, navigate relationships in both crypto and the broader technology ecosystem, and ensure that entrepreneurs have an excellent experience engaging with Coinbase.
Nice to haves:
Computer Science degree or experience in software engineering.
Familiarity with cryptocurrency and Coinbase's business.
