Job Title: Quantitative Business Analyst, Analytics and Decision Suppor...
Description:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: San Bruno, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in working with datasets and conducting data analysis using SQL and Python.
Experience creating executive communications (e.g., memos, slide decks, etc.) and presenting to non-technical/analytics audiences.
Preferred qualifications:

Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Math, Physics, Engineering).
Experience designing data models or table schema.
Experience in application of machine learning such as supervised/unsupervised learning, forecasting, predictive modeling, etc.
Experience working in consulting, direct-to-consumer, or similar industries.
Experience working with multiple functions/domains and managing projects.
About the job
The YouTube Strategy, Business Operations (BizOps), and Analytics (SBA) team’s mission is to make YouTube commercially sustainable and more valuable, by identifying and steering the business towards opportunities, guiding the organization to make the best possible decisions, and enabling effective implementation and operations. With teams world wide, SBA teams work with YouTube leadership across the product, engineering, and business organizations to address challenges and opportunities across the company, help chart the long-term direction for YouTube, and provide analytics and decision support for planning.
As a Quantitative Business Analyst within Analytics and Decision Support, you'll be part of a community of technical data analysts who work on impactful projects analyzing the content and distribution partnerships, the creator and user ecosystem, and business generation. You will help guide business leadership on optimizing the effectiveness and efficiency of our partner, operations, and business-facing teams. You will work on strategic business challenges centered on the economics of YouTube’s content business. You will provide analytical support for the business teams, including performance measurement, causal impact, estimation, predictive modeling, and metric definition.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
Responsibilities
Act as a thought leader in the creation of planning, strategy, objectives and key results (OKRs), and KPI development for the business domain. Make strategic and operational recommendations to achieve goals.
Utilize excellent communication skills to work cross-functionally with business leaders, Marketing, Operations, and Product teams in order to identify opportunities, design, and assess improvements to YouTube’s business.
Make business recommendations using effective presentation skills, conveying findings at multiple levels including executive leadership, managers, and peers through visual displays of quantitative information.
Manage larger strategic and cross-functional initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis.
Conduct non-routine analyses, including data gathering from large and complex datasets, processing, analysis employing advanced statistical and machine learning methods, with ongoing deliverables to improve the quality of Insights teams.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

As an Associate Business Analyst, you will provide support to consultants and technical teams in different stages including design, architecture and detailing of processes, development, configuration and deployment of high-quality solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Tempe AZ or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel.
At least 1 year of IT experience.
At least 1 year of experience in Manufacturing / Supply Chain/Finance/Material Management Domain
U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are not able to sponsor at this time.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience / Knowledge in any of the above Business Processes.
Plus - Experience in any ERP Application packages / Cloud Applications.
Willing to go through a 4-6 weeks' ORC training program upon joining.
Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.
Experience and desire to co-ordinate between multiple stakeholders across multiple locations.

The job may also entail sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Candidates should be able to effectively communicate by telephone, email, and face to face.

About Us

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

To learn more about Infosys and see our ideas in action please visit us at www.Infosys.com.

The Reporting/Data Analyst-Workday will be a critical part of the Human Resources team, reporting to the Vice President People Services and Technology. In this role you will be the primary subject matter expert for our reporting/data analytics solutions and needs. You will work closely with the VP People Services and Technology, HR Business Units, and Managers/Leaders to build impactful partnerships with various stakeholders. General Information
Ref #: 32579
Functional Area: Client Solutions & Analytics
Employee Type: Full Time
Location: Newport Beach
Date published: 09-Nov-2021
About Us:
We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $1.92 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 2,800 employees in 17 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.
PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.
Position Description:
Pacific Investment Management Company LLC (PIMCO) seeks a Quantitative Research Analyst for its Newport Beach, CA location. Job ID 32579
Duties: Apply statistical, optimization, and probability methods together with Economic and Finance theories to build systematic trading models for Client Analytics and Solutions teams. Conduct research, develop internal infrastructure, and build analytical tools to support development of systematic strategies and trading models. Research, evaluate and utilize alternative new data sources with an emphasis on effectively positioning data, ingesting data and understanding the implications of data. Engage in fund modelling and back-test analysis for different trading strategies across various asset classes. Collaborate with specialist Portfolio Managers to understand market factors and build strategies to systematically capitalize on inefficiencies. Conduct exploratory research to identify inefficiencies using statistical approaches. Analyze model performance, portfolio construction and optimization in the presence of real-world constraints, as well as transaction cost analysis (TCA) and risk management. Perform portfolio level analytics, including portfolio optimization, risk profile analysis, stress test and factor analysis. Lead the development of Application Programming interface and quantitative tools for the quantitative desk.
Position Requirements:
Must have a Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Financial Engineering, or related quantitative field. Required experience and/or academic coursework must include: Performing quantitative research utilizing mathematical, statistical, optimization, and probability theories and tools, including multi-horizon optimization, statistical inference, convex programming, stochastic differential equations, stochastic process, martingale theory, Monte Carlo simulations, financial derivative theories, differential equations, Hidden Markov model, and error correction; Utilizing SQL to access databases for quantitative research; Conducting regression analysis and factor analysis to identify signal alphas and evaluate strategies; Programming in Python and R to code strategies and analytics tools in support of risk analysis; Conducting back-testing to analyze historical data, and testing historical performance using time series analysis; Evaluating performance of funds and strategies using statistical analysis including VAR, drawdown analysis, Sharpe Ratio, skewness, and z-score; Conducting financial forecasting on risk profiles and asset performance of historical data using Bootstrap and Monte Carlo simulations.
Background check and drug screening required prior to employment. Pacific Investment Management Company LLC is an EEO/AA Employer. This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Pacific Investment Management Company LLC’s Employee Referral Program.
Benefits:
PIMCO is committed to offering a comprehensive portfolio of employee benefits designed to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Benefits vary by location but may include:
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Life insurance and travel coverage
401(k) (defined contribution) retirement savings, retirement plan, pension contribution from your first day of employment
Work/life programs such as flexible work arrangements, parental leave and support, employee assistance plan, commuter benefits, health club discounts, and educational/CFA certification reimbursement programs
Community involvement opportunities with The PIMCO Foundation in each PIMCO office

CB Insights is looking for a motivated Community Lead to help manage communications with enterprise-facing companies. You'll have the opportunity to act as the face and voice of our brand.

The role you'll play:

The Research Products team is in the process of building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program. The program aims to provide companies with an opportunity to present their products, services, and business strategies to our analysts who cover the technology market - via surveys and phone calls.

As a CB Insights Community Lead, you will set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies with enterprise-facing companies. Further, you will be tasked with identifying appropriate contacts, driving survey participation rates, and building relationships, in effort to generate rich data that our research team and clients can use.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly ten years of experience in surveying companies and creating research products. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products. One primary focus this year is building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program - you can expect to hone in on your communication skills and attention to detail, as you assist the team in initial outreach and ongoing communications with 1000's of enterprise-facing companies.

Your main tasks:

Identify companies focused on selling to enterprise customers
Create contact lists
Set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies using Qualtrics, Outreach, and other engagement platforms
Test and optimize marketing and outreach tactics to increase survey participation rates
Respond to company queries in a timely manner
Build relationships with analyst relation teams and executives across dozens of industries
Ensure our analysts have the necessary materials from companies when producing research
Liaise between companies and our research team
Liaise with our marketing and PR teams

What you bring to the table:

BA / BS
Excellent verbal communication skills over both phone and email
Excellent writing skills
Ability to multitask and work independently
Solid attention to detail, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Experience planning and leading community initiatives
Ability to identify and track relevant community KPIs
Experience with MS Office apps, Google apps, and Salesforce
Experience with survey tools, such as Qualtrics (preferable, not required)
5H's: Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpful and Humility

What's CB Insights All About

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

The Perks:

Amazing culture that emphasizes Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpfulness, and Humility. Learn more here
A newsletter that 700k+ people follow: Sign up here.
Be Healthy: Health with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision insurance along with unlimited/take what you need sick day policy
Plan for the future: 401k with up to 4% match
Continued Learning: $1,000 yearly continuing education stipend
Rest and Relax: Competitive vacation and holiday plans

We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply if your experience is close to what we are looking for.

Equal Opportunity Employer: CB Insights is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Role:
The Inventory Control Analyst will work with distribution teams, as well as cross functional stakeholders in the organization, to create dashboards, tools, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that describe inventory trends within the organization. They will also lead efforts and drive strategic projects directly related to improving these KPIs. This role requires you to acquire deep subject matter knowledge about systems, distribution, and fulfillment processes and KPIs used to manage and drive the business. It is essential that you can think strategically, connect the dots in the bigger picture, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables to drive operational improvements. The role is expected to simultaneously handle multiple projects of department-level scale and global reach.
Responsibilities:Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to ensure that they are accurate and timely (from and to all external and/or internal operations)Develop and supply strategic reporting to the Operations team, including: quarterly summaries, monthly trends, week-over-week analysis, and daily reportingDevelop trend reporting on top inventory offenders in all functions of the warehouse for inaccuracies to help operations leadership in seeking to understand root causesInnovate and maintain cycle count programs in a perpetual inventory environment at all sites globallyPerform thorough research and documentation on inventory discrepancies (to identify root causes and supply possible solutions)Develop and drive departmental and organizational goals through data analysis with the ability to speak to multiple levels of the businessTake a high level of ownership of site training and team development based around inventory, with the goal of preventing inaccuraciesDaily reporting on variance trends on site including top offenders by username per function, top bins with discrepancies, top pick zones with errors, and any additional root cause investigationsConsolidate quarterly, monthly, and weekly summaries of inventory adjustments, including: inventory discrepancies, write offs, variances, and overall value trends.Identify process and system gaps, and highlight areas for optimization/automation with the goal of driving projects to improve these areas.

Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, Analytics, or Industrial Engineering (or relevant experience)Preferred: 2+ years work experience in finance, supply chain, operations, or inventory control/managementAdvanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and ProjectAdvanced skills using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus

At Realtor.com we're putting data science and analytics at the center of our marketing and advertising strategy. Don't have a marketing background? No problem! With over 100M web visits you'll use your ability to process and look at complex data to decide how we get our message of personalized choice to consumers effectively. Be the business leader for a specific marketing channel (TV, Google/YouTube, Facebook, etc.) and learn to be an ad platform expert over time

Design smart and statistically significant tests to determine best-in-class media strategies
Regularly update Realtor.com senior executive team on marketing performance, opportunities, and testing strategy
Embrace an agile self-starter attitude to tackle and solve new challenges on the quantitative marketing team with data

4+ years of experience in a Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Business Analyst or similar role using SQL and/or Python/R
(preferred not required) Some marketing or business experience
Quantitative background in business analytics, statistics, mathematics, finance, economics, engineering, or computer science with a strong academic record
Fluency in SQL and Python/R for data manipulation, and validation
Demonstrate intellectual curiosity and interest in solving problems, particularly using data to help answer somewhat nebulous questions
Capable of clearly communicating complex analyses to a non-technical audience
Thrive in a fast-paced environment with an ability to change direction and meet deadlines

Information regarding the Drug Free Workplace Program can be found at www.samhsa.gov/workplace. TVA Non-Nuclear employees in Testing Designated Positions, including those performing safety-sensitive duties are also subject to random drug testing. TVA Nuclear employees are subject to random alcohol and drug tests in accordance with 10 CFR Part 26 as mandated by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC).

Be on the front line. Amplify the CBI voice. Drive new biz growth.

CB Insights is looking for a motivated Community Lead to help manage communications with enterprise-facing companies. You'll have the opportunity to act as the face and voice of our brand.

The role you'll play:

The Research Products team is in the process of building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program. The program aims to provide companies with an opportunity to present their products, services, and business strategies to our analysts who cover the technology market - via surveys and phone calls.

As a CB Insights Community Lead, you will set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies with enterprise-facing companies. Further, you will be tasked with identifying appropriate contacts, driving survey participation rates, and building relationships, in effort to generate rich data that our research team and clients can use.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly ten years of experience in surveying companies and creating research products. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products. One primary focus this year is building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program - you can expect to hone in on your communication skills and attention to detail, as you assist the team in initial outreach and ongoing communications with 1000's of enterprise-facing companies.

Your main tasks:

Identify companies focused on selling to enterprise customers
Create contact lists
Set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies using Qualtrics, Outreach, and other engagement platforms
Test and optimize marketing and outreach tactics to increase survey participation rates
Respond to company queries in a timely manner
Build relationships with analyst relation teams and executives across dozens of industries
Ensure our analysts have the necessary materials from companies when producing research
Liaise between companies and our research team
Liaise with our marketing and PR teams

What you bring to the table:

BA / BS
Excellent verbal communication skills over both phone and email
Excellent writing skills
Ability to multitask and work independently
Solid attention to detail, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Experience planning and leading community initiatives
Ability to identify and track relevant community KPIs
Experience with MS Office apps, Google apps, and Salesforce
Experience with survey tools, such as Qualtrics (preferable, not required)
5H's: Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpful and Humility

What's CB Insights All About

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

The Perks:

Amazing culture that emphasizes Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpfulness, and Humility. Learn more here
A newsletter that 700k+ people follow: Sign up here.
Be Healthy: Health with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision insurance along with unlimited/take what you need sick day policy
Plan for the future: 401k with up to 4% match
Continued Learning: $1,000 yearly continuing education stipend
Rest and Relax: Competitive vacation and holiday plans

We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply if your experience is close to what we are looking for.

Equal Opportunity Employer: CB Insights is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Ad Sales
We are looking for a measurement rockstar to join the band! This Research Analyst will be an integral part of the Advertising Analytics team - driving our value proposition with advertisers and agencies by demonstrating the power of Spotify as a media partner.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
What You'll Do
Execute ad effectiveness research studies for our Consumer Packaged Goods and Health advertiser and agency partners
Work extensively across all areas of attitudinal survey research - survey design, project management, data integrity and fieldwork supervision, troubleshooting, data analysis, storytelling and presentation
Daily responsibilities may also include offline and online conversion measurement, and viewability and audience verification measurement solutions
Help maintain global databases of advertising effectiveness and build benchmarks across key metrics (ad formats, ad platforms, client verticals, user demographics, etc.)
Educate internal and external stakeholders on performance trends and best practices to inform business decisions across our business
Partner with our B2B Marketing team to create case studies from top-performing campaigns
Execute against industry and client measurement strategies
We’re an ever-evolving and highly-valued team - responsibilities may shift over time, and there is a huge opportunity to drive impact within Spotify!
Who You Are
You have 3-5+ years of experience in digital advertising research, ideally within the Consumer Packaged Goods or Health industries – at a research vendor, media owner, advertiser or agency partner
You have a strong background in quantitative advertising research, with skills designing and analyzing quantitative research studies - relevant measurement areas include:Reach: viewability, on-target percentage, etc. Resonance: brand awareness, consideration, intent, etc.Reaction: attribution, sales lift, online-to-online, foot traffic, econometric modeling, etc.
You have demonstrated expertise in data analysis and storytelling, going beyond the “what” to tell the “why” within research results
You are hands-on and inherently curious, and go above and beyond if you find data taking you in interesting and/or unexpected places
You have the foundational knowledge of the digital marketing ecosystem, measurement capability landscape, and how it all works from a technical perspective
You are a positive and collaborative team player who values building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders
Global research experience and foreign language skills are a plus
Skills in big data tools like R, Python, SQL or SPSS are a plus
Where You'll Be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences.
Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 345 million users.

.

CO - Golden
.

Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Protocols
Employment at NREL is contingent upon your compliance with all NREL and DOE safety protocols and mitigation efforts directed at the COVID-19 pandemic. At present, NREL requires all employees to be immunized against COVID-19. Upon hire, new employees must be prepared to provide proof of vaccination on your first day of employment. All employees must have completed vaccinations by November 1, 2021.
Working at NREL
The National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), located at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in Golden, Colorado is the nation's primary laboratory for research and development of renewable energy and energy efficiency technologies.
From day one at NREL, you’ll connect with coworkers driven by the same mission to save the planet. By joining an organization that values a supportive, inclusive, and flexible work environment, you’ll have the opportunity to engage through our eight employee resource groups, numerous employee-driven clubs, and learning and professional development classes.
NREL supports inclusive, diverse, and unbiased hiring practices that promote creativity and innovation. By collaborating with organizations that focus on diverse talent pools, reaching out to underrepresented demographics, and providing an inclusive application and interview process, our Talent Acquisition team aims to hear all voices equally. We strive to attract a highly diverse workforce and create a culture where every employee feels welcomed and respected and they can be their authentic selves.
Job Description
The National Renewable Energy Laboratory (“NREL”) NREL is looking for a compensation analyst to join its growing Compensation Team. Join a team of talented compensation analysts at the forefront of a rapidly growing national laboratory. The compensation analyst will assist with the administration of NREL’s compensation programs and will provide support to the HR business partners, the talent acquisition team, and other groups and individuals as needed. This position will report directly to the Total Rewards Manager.
Remote work options are available. Relocation to Colorado is not required.
.
Basic Qualifications
This role can be hired at a Level II or a Level III


Professional III Qualifications: Relevant Bachelor's Degree and 5 or more years of experience, or equivalent relevant education/experience, or, relevant Master's Degree and 3 or more years of experience, or PhD, or JD.


Professional II Qualifications: Relevant Bachelor's Degree and 2 or more years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant Master's Degree or equivalent relevant education/experience.
.
Additional Required Qualifications
Experienced in job analysis and reviewing job descriptions.
Ensures proper administration of NREL compensation programs
Research, benchmarks, and analyzes data to determine compensation trends and establish equitable compensation levels and pay bands
Consults with recruiting team, hiring managers, and other members of compensation team to evaluate appropriate compensation offers for new hires and internal job moves
Consults with managers and other HR members to complete job analysis and evaluations
Coordinates survey participation and performs survey job matching
Consolidates, interprets, and presents data analysis on a variety of compensation related topics
Leads the annual funding request process
Assists in the allocation of compensation budgets and tracking of actual spend versus budget
Develops and provides communications and training programs on variety of compensation topics
Maintains job description database; builds and updates descriptions as needed
Adheres to all compensation policies and procedures
Preferred Qualifications
National laboratory or DOE experience
Experience with Workday
Experience with MarketPay
Experience evaluating market survey data
Experience bench marking salaries
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent analytical, quantitative, communication, and interpersonal skills
Ability to provide a high level of confidentiality concerning employee information
Proven ability to work in a consultative manner as a team member in a collaborative environment
Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and see projects through to completion
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
.
Annual Salary Range (based on full-time 40 hours per week)
Annual Salary Range: $73,900 - $133,100
Offers will typically be made in the bottom half of the listed range. NREL takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position's work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.
Benefits Summary
Benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance; short*- and long-term disability insurance; pension benefits*; 403(b) Employee Savings Plan with employer match*; life and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance; personal time off (PTO) and sick leave; paid holidays; and tuition reimbursement*. NREL employees may be eligible for, but are not guaranteed, performance-, merit-, and achievement- based awards that include a monetary component. Some positions may be eligible for relocation expense reimbursement. Limited-term positions are not eligible for long-term disability or tuition reimbursement.
* Based on eligibility rules
Submission Guidelines
Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at NREL you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified. Applications are not kept on file for future positions. Please include a cover letter and resume with each position application.

The US Product Delivery Monitoring Team is looking for an Analyst/Senior Analyst that will partner with stakeholders to analyze and inform the latest Personal Lines pricing and underwriting programs for GRM US. This position offers the opportunity to be a direct and key contributor to GRM US profit and growth goals and help shape current and future pricing programs. You will be responsible for defining key metrics, analyzing & visualizing new product results, identifying key trends, maintaining communication & relationships with stakeholders across GRM, and informing future product rollouts. This position is open to candidates either seeking a hybrid or full-time eventual return to the Boston or Seattle office, or for employees seeking full-time remote work within the US.
**This is a ranged posting, Analyst or Senior Analyst. Position offered will be at manager discretion based on skills and experience.**
In this role, you can expect to:
Fully own the top-line monitoring and analysis (close ratio, premium levels, mix, et al) of major program supporting Liberty Mutual & Safeco Auto/Property lines of business.
Provides analysis & timely updates on product performance to key stakeholders including Director of State Operations, GRM US Leadership, Solutions, Modeling, Economics, and fellow Delivery team members.
Collaborates with Data Strategy & Reporting and the Data Office to ensure the proper monitoring datasets and reports are available Day 1.
Offers insights into the design and expectations of future product launches.
Queries data to conduct ad hoc analysis of metrics; manipulates and understands the data at hand to tell a comprehensive and insightful story to a non-technical audience.
Opportunity to develop new visuals, reports, and analytical techniques for use across GRM.
Will become subject matter expert in one or more leading Personal Lines rollout(s).
Takes an active role in onboarding and asking questions to gain complete understanding of the rollout process.
Provides recommendations to training and processes to manager/mentor, with an eye to continued process improvement. May begin creating and updating training materials
Ideal candidate will have:
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and data analysis software (e.g., SAS, Access).
Experience in data visualization software such as PowerBI or Tableau is a plus, but not required.
Prior Personal Lines experience is a plus, but not required.
Must have proficient planning, organizational, analytical, decision making and communication skills.
Responsibilities:
Conducts moderate complexity product analysis under minimal supervision.
As subject matter expert for assigned states, completes state reviews and similar work for basic states with minimal supervision or complex states with moderate supervision.
Queries data to conduct ad hoc analysis of metrics.
Serves as point person for moderate complexity country wide implementations.
Serves as team member on medium-term or moderate complexity projects and may occasionally lead own work stream.
Provides recommendations to training and processes to manager/mentor Provides analysis to help support business decisions.
Provides thoughtful recommendations to state teams on pricing, strategy, etc.
Conducts in depth research of competitor filings utilizing various sources.
Research may be at the state, competitor or countrywide level.
Based on strong understanding of how competitor actions impact marketplace, distribution channel and customers, proactively identifies and brings to attention to state teams and managers significant competitor filings.
Contributes to the improvement and development of instructions and training materials. May begin creating and updating training materials.
Actively shares job knowledge with less experienced analysts.
Leads job shadow discussions with less experienced analysts.
May be assigned to mentor a new hire, depending on experience.
Bachelor's degree in business, economics, or other quantitative field.
Minimum 2 years, typically 3 years or more of relevant experience.
Completion on product development program.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and data analysis software (e.g., SAS, Access).
Must have good planning, organizational, analytical, decision making and communication skills.

Mellon is a global multi-specialist manager dedicated to serving our clients with a full spectrum of single and multi-asset investment strategies and solutions. With roots dating back to 1933, Mellon has been innovating across asset classes for generations and has the combined scale and capabilities to offer clients a broad range of solutions. From asset class expertise to broad market exposures, clients drive what we do. We are holistic in approach, client driven and committed to investment excellence. We aim to be a key partner for our clients by delivering customized investment outcomes and best-in-class service.
Mellon is seeking a Junior Quantitative Research Analyst. Responsibilities include:
Contribute to research effort to produce strong investment management performance across the Multi Asset strategies.
Generate and evaluate investment ideas for forecasting risk and return characteristics of assets.
Rigorously formulate and test fundamental hypotheses against empirical data.
Review, evaluate, and modify current academic and industry research for use in our investment models.
Communicate with other researchers, portfolio management, and trading desk to enhance research and portfolio management process.
Support senior individuals with client and marketing requests.
Work with moderate direction from Senior Research Analyst.
Qualifications - External
Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred.
3 to 6 years of investment experience preferred. Strong financial acumen and financial modeling skills '
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced/graduate degree preferred. (MFE, MBA, Master's/PhD in finance, accounting, economics, engineering, or similar field)
1 to 3 years of investment experience preferred.
Quantitative skills, including formal training in econometrics or statistics.
Strong programming skills preferred and an active interest in the application of computer technology to financial research and portfolio management.
Matlab, R and/or Python. Familiarity with SQL and noSQL desirable.
Must be able to work independently, have a strong sense of fundamental financial drivers.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Job Description:
The Department
Strategic Advisers is a registered investment advisor and wholly owned subsidiary of FMR LLC that provides investment management services to clients through Fidelity’s retail and institutional distribution channels. For more than 20 years, Strategic Advisers has specialized in the design, construction and management of asset allocation solutions, as well as the methodologies for many of Fidelity’s investment planning tools, to help investors reach their financial goals. With over $300 billion in assets under management in a blend of Fidelity and third party investment vehicles, the Strategic Advisers team of investment professionals constructs and manages asset allocation portfolios for over one million customer accounts.
The Role
Fidelity Strategic Advisers continues to refine its mission of providing simplicity to customers’ complex financial needs. In the future, we expect clients to demand even more investment solutions from us. As a result, we anticipate a significant and sustained focus on investment solution innovation, research and development over the next several years.
We are seeking a Quantitative Analyst to join our Investment Research & Development team. As a member of this team, you will play a key role in the innovation, research and development of new investment solutions. You will collaborate across teams to both drive forward current research and development efforts and to pursue promising new investment solutions though from idea, design, pilot and to launch.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate will play a key innovation role in designing, testing and piloting new equity and fixed income strategies for managed account clients. You will work with the product team to determine design criteria and investment mandates. You will back-test strategies, conduct after-tax analysis and risk analysis to determine optimal investment strategy. You will ensure that new strategies successfully transition from the R&D team to the investment management teams who are responsible for ongoing management. The successful candidate may engage in a wide variety of innovation efforts within Strategic Advisers and across Fidelity.
Skills and Knowledge:
5+ years of experience in a quantitative equity research role
Expert knowledge of portfolio optimization methods and risk models
3+ years of experience programming in R or Python
System and UI design experience a plus
Experience with quantitative portfolio tools such as Barra, Northfield, Axioma and Factset
Ability to work with different vendor data sets sourced from Oracle or Flat files
Proficiency in Excel/VBA is desired
Interest and experience in one or more areas such as factor research, manager selection, ESG, AI and machine learning
Excellent communication skills
Experience with presenting results and concepts to large audiences
After-tax research experience a plus
Willing to code and eager to learn
Location:
Boston, MA
Certifications:
Company Overview

At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning and growth so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. We welcome associates from different backgrounds and with different perspectives to help us innovate and make a difference for our customers and our communities.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.
Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Leave of Absence/Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 2.

THE COMPANY
For more than 170 years, National Life Group (“NLG”) has aimed to keep their promises to provide families stability in good times and in bad. And throughout that history, we have provided peace of mind to those families as they plan their futures.
As a mission-driven business, the cause of what we do is as important as the products we sell. Our cause is a very simple one, directed at the people who live and work on America’s Main Streets: “To Do good in our communities and with the individual families we serve.”
The investment management company of NLG manages approximately $41 billion in AUM. Our purpose is simple – to set up (or help) NLG to keep its promises. How we do this – an obsessive focus on delivering investment results. We drive results through a rigorous but collaborative investment process, and we hold ourselves to the highest of standards, both as investors and teammates. While our process is based on rigor, our culture is based on our guiding principles: Meritocracy, Uncompromising Transparency, Intellectual Honesty, Performance Driven Learning, and a Relentless Pursuit of Excellence. These principles serve as the foundation of our team. They govern the way we conduct ourselves, how we interact with teammates and how we approach every investment decision. We act with the integrity and humility required to make the investment decision that is right for the firm, and ultimately our policyholders. Our culture has been deliberately built to foster curiosity and provide opportunities to learn and grow, both as people and investors. The flat and collaborative nature of our team promotes an atmosphere where the best ideas are continually expressed and rewarded. Our pursuit of excellence is unwavering.
THE POSITION
Position Title Junior Quantitative Analyst
Position Summary
The Junior Quantitative Analyst will aid development of analytical models and systems designed to support the investment decision process of National Life Group. The role will interact with asset class teams across liquid and illiquid debt markets including corporate bonds, structured products, and whole loans. The Junior Quantitative Analyst will provide analytical support across the investment lifecycle, aiding in the development of investment strategies, the security selection process, trade execution, and position monitoring. The Junior Quantitative Analyst will have the opportunity to integrate quantitative research and statistical modeling into the investment and portfolio optimization process.
Responsibilities
Create and improve analytical tools that aid the visualization and understanding of complex data sets across the debt capital markets and investment portfolios
Build and maintain systematic investing models to inform sector allocation and security selection decisions
Develop databases and related analytics to assist in sector and security evaluation, with an emphasis on structured products including CLOs, CMBS, and non-agency RMBS
Improve ad-hoc desk analytics and assist in developing repeatable processes and analysis for asset class analysts and traders
Utilize Tableau / Microsoft BI, and email-based reporting to automate and distribute insights among the investment team
Leverage understanding of trading and analytical workflows and apply technical skills to improve and automate processes
Collaborate with internal groups to ensure data integrity and usability, and improve upon existing data infrastructure to support analytical needs
THE PERSON
Pivotal Experience & Expertise
Undergraduate or advanced degree in Engineering, Mathematical Finance, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field of study
Experience with either a workplace or academic setting in quantitative financial analysis, modeling, statistical analysis, and/or development roles
Strong programming experience in SQL and Python; knowledge of additional programming languages considered helpful
Knowledge of Intex, Aladdin, and/or Bloomberg and related APIs
Experience using Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools
Ability to apply code development best practices
Intense intellectual curiosity with the desire to seek new challenges while continuously learning
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to connect to form meaningful working partnerships
Inclusive team player with a collaborative and cooperative approach
Strong work ethic and proactive professional disposition
Experience driving projects to completion
Cultural Fit
Results-driven mindset
A coach who knows how to guide others - a good listener and an effective communicator who can execute, lead by example, and add business value
Thrives in an environment where the best ideas that drive the best results are rewarded
Has the integrity to communicate all relevant facts and information in evaluating decisions and the humility to admit what they do not know
Love of learning – comfortable in an organization that seeks to continually learn from its failures and successes to drive better investment decisions
Comfortable with ambiguity and the mentality required to address and ultimately own those ambiguous situations – finds answers and solutions, a problem solver
Comfortable giving and receiving constructive feedback in both real time and structured environments
Demonstrates transparent, direct, and open communication across the organization
Promotes collaboration and has a “firm first” attitude – does what is right for the firm
Commitment to our mission – keeping our promises, vision – to bring peace of mind to everyone we touch and values – Do good. Be good. Make good.

Job Description
Role Summary
At Citadel Securities, a leading global market maker, our team of quantitative researchers models the markets and brings trading strategies to life every day. Specifically, this team develops and tests automated quant trading strategies using sophisticated statistical techniques. We’re looking for an extraordinary quantitative researcher who is committed to our core values that include winning, acting with integrity, continuously learning, and cultivating a meritocracy.
Depending on your background and expertise, opportunities are available in Chicago, New York, London, Dublin, Zurich, Hong Kong or Sydney
Objectives
Conduct research and statistical analyses in the evaluation of securities
Work with large data sets, including unconventional data sources, to predict and test statistical market patterns
Conceptualize valuation strategies, develop and continuously improve mathematical models, and translate algorithms into code
Back test and implement trading models and signals in a live trading environment
Skills and Preferred Qualifications
Advanced training in mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science, or another highly quantitative field
Proficiency in probability & statistics (e.g. time-series analysis, machine learning, pattern recognition, NLP)
Prior experience working in a data driven research environment
Hands on programming experience in scripting (e.g. Python), analytical packages (e.g. R, Matlab) and/or compiled languages (e.g. C++)
A background demonstrating strong analytical problem solving skills
An ability to communicate advanced concepts in a concise and logical way
Proficiency in creating and using algorithms to meticulously investigate and work through large data or error-checking problems
About Citadel Securities

Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. In partnering with us, our clients, including asset managers, banks, broker-dealers, hedge funds, government agencies and public pension programs are able to gain a powerful trading advantage and are better positioned to meet their investment goals.

The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.

CB Insights is looking for a motivated Community Lead to help manage communications with enterprise-facing companies. You'll have the opportunity to act as the face and voice of our brand.

The role you'll play:

The Research Products team is in the process of building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program. The program aims to provide companies with an opportunity to present their products, services, and business strategies to our analysts who cover the technology market - via surveys and phone calls.

As a CB Insights Community Lead, you will set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies with enterprise-facing companies. Further, you will be tasked with identifying appropriate contacts, driving survey participation rates, and building relationships, in effort to generate rich data that our research team and clients can use.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly ten years of experience in surveying companies and creating research products. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products. One primary focus this year is building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program - you can expect to hone in on your communication skills and attention to detail, as you assist the team in initial outreach and ongoing communications with 1000's of enterprise-facing companies.

Your main tasks:

Identify companies focused on selling to enterprise customers
Create contact lists
Set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies using Qualtrics, Outreach, and other engagement platforms
Test and optimize marketing and outreach tactics to increase survey participation rates
Respond to company queries in a timely manner
Build relationships with analyst relation teams and executives across dozens of industries
Ensure our analysts have the necessary materials from companies when producing research
Liaise between companies and our research team
Liaise with our marketing and PR teams

What you bring to the table:

BA / BS
Excellent verbal communication skills over both phone and email
Excellent writing skills
Ability to multitask and work independently
Solid attention to detail, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Experience planning and leading community initiatives
Ability to identify and track relevant community KPIs
Experience with MS Office apps, Google apps, and Salesforce
Experience with survey tools, such as Qualtrics (preferable, not required)

Who we are...
AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.
What we are looking for…
A M&A Analyst who will support our M&A team in building and managing our M&A pipeline by performing deep quantitative and qualitative analyses; coordinating asset valuations and supporting transactions from inception to close. This person is a total modelling rock star with deep knowledge and love of real estate and M&A transactions.
What you’ll do…
Analyze new acquisition opportunities and prepare financial analysis on the viability of each transaction, incorporating a variety of financing and transaction structures.
Perform acquisition due diligence, reviewing historical financial and operating performance at the company and property level, evaluating customer agreements and other documentation to identify key drivers of value and risk and surfacing necessary follow ups and gaps in information
Complete accurate and thorough worksheets, reports, briefs, and proposals within agreed upon timeframes while tracking and communicating progress to senior management along the way.
Correspond with business owners and internal functional teams to resolve outstanding questions and complete tasks related to transaction execution and closing
Work cross-functionally to enhance utilization of internal data in order to increase accuracy of modeling and the efficiency of the transaction lifecycle
Work closely with the CFO and VP of Finance to create a framework for tracking accuracy of financial analysis as compared to actual performance.
What you’ll bring…
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Finance, Real Estate)
2+ years in Finance, Real Estate evaluation, or related fields
Deep knowledge of real estate valuation and financial modelling, travel trends, hospitality, hotels, tourism and the short-term / vacation rental market.
A passion for all things real estate, an agility and ability to adapt to changing and ambiguous situations, and a general hunger for more.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, demonstrated ability to perform quantitative and qualitative analysis of assets using financial modelling techniques. Demonstrated ability to effectively define and resolve problems that balance multiple needs and interests.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present ideas, instructions and information effectively, both orally and in writing.
Perks and Benefits...
Salary: $80,000 - $100,000 + equity
Benefits and Unlimited Paid Time Off
Team bonding and off-site events
Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties
Dog-friendly office
When you join AvantStay…
You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. Your place within the colossal travel and real estate industries will leave you with a wealth of opportunities to feel both challenged to innovate and rewarded for your efforts. Of course, we will offer you pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. AvantStay is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at AvantStay.

Job Description
Are you a curious individual, passionate about digging through data to deeply understand market dynamics, with a strong desire to provide actionable insights that influence an organization's strategic direction? We have a fantastic opportunity for you in the Data Platform Group.

The DPG Market Intelligence team is seeking experienced Market Intelligence Analysts to:
1. Conduct market research in a DPG business area by analyzing internal and external data sources, including primary and secondary research
2. Gather data through discussions with industry analysts and subject matter experts
3. Perform market sizing and forecasting using predictive modeling, statistics, machine learning, data mining, and other data analysis techniques
4. Proactively report on key market trends/changing market environment and act as internal consultant and advisor to key stakeholders

The successful candidate will be a collaborative professional, focused on internal customer challenges, very comfortable doing detailed numerical market analysis, as well as creating presentations that synthesize complex information and tell a compelling story with data. Must have strong understanding of our Data Platform Group business segments, products and technologies. They will help enhance our teams' tools, methods and procedures to ensure high quality and timely deliverables.

Skills:
A self-starter who works well in a fast-paced, dynamic, ambiguous, matrixed environment
Be able to work well independently and with the broader team
Project management and organizational skills required to plan, execute, and meet customer commitments on-time
Demonstrates high quality work through diligent documentation of process/methodology, data sources, and assumptions
Motivated by continuous learning, provides and receives feedback in peer reviews and stakeholder reviews
Business acumen: Knowledge of Data-center market segments, products and technologies
Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills as this position requires interaction at multiple management levels, across a variety of job functions, and with industry partners, analysts, and consultants
Qualifications
Candidates must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Requirements listed below would be obtained through a combination of Industry job relevant experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.
Minimum Education:
Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, finance, computer science, engineering or equivalent couurse of study
Minimum Qualifications:
3+ years of experience in one of the following areas: Market intelligence, data analytics, data science or market research
4+ years of Excel
3+ years of experience in R or Python
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, finance, computer science, engineering, or equivalent course of study
Experience in Advanced Analytics
Experience with web scraping using open source software and 3rd party APIs

Summary

ABI Research seeks intellectually curious analysts at all levels, from entry-level to seasoned research directors. Reporting to one of our group Vice Presidents, successful candidates will contribute to one or more of our research areas and will work as a part of an ambitious team to produce premium quantitative and qualitative analysis. Specific coverage areas will be determined based upon the candidate’s interests, experience, and client demand.
Specific responsibilities include:

Author syndicated research reports, market forecasts, and articles covering technologies and related markets.
Work on custom research and consulting projects, providing leadership on approach and methodology.
Represent ABI Research as a key expert in our coverage areas.
Interview key stakeholders across the entire technology supply chain and understand how emerging technologies will make their way into the marketplace.
Prepare presentations and participate in conferences, webinars, and online events.
Be an active team member and own a significant part of the overall research agenda, including commercial activities.
Support and share expertise with other ABI Research analysts.
Support sales and business development activities by preparing customer-specific analysis, and by participating in key meetings with clients, prospects, and partners.


Desired Skills:

Eloquent and outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in both quantitative and qualitative analysis would be beneficial.
Passion and enthusiasm for technology innovation are musts for this role.


Location:

ABI Research is fully remote in the U.S., with physical offices in the U.K. and Singapore. Analysts may be fully remote, report to an office, or operate in a hybrid role based on skills and experience.
About ABI Research

ABI Research is a global technology intelligence firm delivering actionable research and strategic guidance to technology leaders, innovators, and decision-makers around the world. Our research focuses on the transformative technologies that are dramatically reshaping industries, economies, and workforces today. ABI Research’s global team of analysts publish groundbreaking studies often years ahead of other technology research and advisory firms, empowering our clients to stay ahead of their markets and their competitors.

Description
MRM&V function at Citizens Bank is responsible for identifying and managing the model risk across the bank in finance, consumer and commercial divisions. The model types include statistical, time-series, econometrics, machine learning,
derivative pricing and qualitative modeling. These models are used to measure risk in AML, CCAR, CECL, VaR, lossforecasting, pricing, profitability, regulatory capital, underwriting, fraud, and fair lending amongst many others.
As a member of MRM&V team, you will be performing independent analytical reviews and validations of models acrossthe bank, focusing on retail loss forecasting and underwriting models. You will contribute to wide variety of other types of
models and collaborate with other model stakeholders.
 Own the model risk validation process including assessmen of the model’s overall suitability for its intended use
and purpose, evaluation of the model’s theoretical framework, analysis and verification of data used in the model
development to ensure its relevance and representativeness, statistical and analytical testing, code replication,
benchmark methodologies, logical tests and accuracy checks to challenge the model effectively.
Communicate modeling concepts and conclusions reached in a clear and concise manner especially to a nonquantitative
audience.
Document all aspects of model risk validation process in a validation report.
Develop strong relationships with managers and analysts in the businesses as well as with the other analytical functions
within the bank.

Qualifications
2+ years of experience in financial risk modeling, econometrics, operations research, or related fields.
Demonstrated understanding of the statistical and theoretical issues in models used in banking. Understanding of recent
AI/Machine Learning techniques and platforms preferred.
Strong understanding of market-relevant measures of risk and, in particular, financial and credit risk modeling.
Programming proficiency in one or more advanced statistical analysis tools such as SAS, R, Python, Matlab, etc.
Good oral and written communication skills.

Education:
Graduate degree in Statistics, economics, or other quantitative fields is required

Hours and Work Schedule
Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday

Why Work for Us
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

Further, you will be tasked with identifying appropriate contacts, driving survey participation rates, and building relationships, in effort to generate rich data that our research team and clients can use.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly ten years of experience in surveying companies and creating research products. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products. One primary focus this year is building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program - you can expect to hone in on your communication skills and attention to detail, as you assist the team in initial outreach and ongoing communications with 1000's of enterprise-facing companies.

Your main tasks:

Identify companies focused on selling to enterprise customers
Create contact lists
Set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies using Qualtrics, Outreach, and other engagement platforms
Test and optimize marketing and outreach tactics to increase survey participation rates
Respond to company queries in a timely manner
Build relationships with analyst relation teams and executives across dozens of industries
Ensure our analysts have the necessary materials from companies when producing research
Liaise between companies and our research team
Liaise with our marketing and PR teams

What you bring to the table:

BA / BS
Excellent verbal communication skills over both phone and email
Excellent writing skills
Ability to multitask and work independently
Solid attention to detail, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Experience planning and leading community initiatives
Ability to identify and track relevant community KPIs
Experience with MS Office apps, Google apps, and Salesforce
Experience with survey tools, such as Qualtrics (preferable, not required)
5H's: Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpful and Humility

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

EMPLOYER’S NAME: GreenSky Administrative Services LLC


POSITION TITLE: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Duties & Responsibilities:

Provide data-driven, quantitative, and qualitative insights. Design, build, deploy, and support scalable statistical and machine learning models. Analyze and model structured and unstructured data. Autonomously identify business risks and opportunities and create strategic or tactical recommendations using data-driven analysis. Provide valuable insights using data-driven analytics to help identify and resolve issues relating to risk and profitability. Partner with internal affiliates to further business understanding and facilitate inter-departmental insight. Provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support for asset performance, suspicious activity, risk exposure, and growth initiatives. Support the business and senior leadership by performing ad-hoc analysis and reporting.
Required Skills/Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Quantitative and Computational Finance or a related quantitative field, plus six (6) months experience as a Quantitative Analyst. Must have experience in data collection, analysis and model creation in analytical tools like Python and R. May work remotely 40% of the time.
GreenSky is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Responsibilities
Understanding of index rebalancing methodologies and of equity market micro-structure
Design and implement statistical signals to improve estimator of future instrument fair value
Work closely with the trading team to generate and test trade ideas with historical data
Presentation of signal to traders and head of desks to be added to existing strategies or to create new strategy
Profile required
Technical Skills:
Required/Must have:Strong background in Statistics, machine learning methods and Python/R
Desired/Plus:Knowledge of object oriented design and developmentOther Programming languages: C#, C++, SQL…
Competencies:Ability to meet deadlines, work independently, and have precise critical judgmentSolid intellectual integrity in work and natural curiosityAnalytical thinking and problem solving skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsTeam-player and be able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Business insight
Within Société Générale Corporate & Investment Banking, the Global Markets Division brings together the Research, Investment and Risk Management Solutions, Execution, Prime Services, Equities, Fixed Income, Futures and Currencies & Commodities structuring capabilities with the objective of providing investors with one integrated multi-asset market solutions team. The Global Markets platform committed to long-term client relationships through value added services and smart solutions. The business uses an advisory and innovation mindset, focused on client needs, with the world leading financial markets engineering team. Global Markets is a leading player in derivatives, unrivaled equity derivatives expertise and #1 in listed derivatives, cross-asset and economic research. Our prime services' offering is a unique combination of execution, clearing, custody and financing services.
We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

Mellon is a global multi-specialist manager dedicated to serving our clients with a full spectrum of single and multi-asset investment strategies and solutions. With roots dating back to 1933, Mellon has been innovating across asset classes for generations and has the combined scale and capabilities to offer clients a broad range of solutions. From asset class expertise to broad market exposures, clients drive what we do. We are holistic in approach, client driven and committed to investment excellence. We aim to be a key partner for our clients by delivering customized investment outcomes and best-in-class service.
Mellon is seeking a Junior Quantitative Research Analyst. Responsibilities include:
Contribute to research effort to produce strong investment management performance across the Multi Asset strategies.
Generate and evaluate investment ideas for forecasting risk and return characteristics of assets.
Rigorously formulate and test fundamental hypotheses against empirical data.
Review, evaluate, and modify current academic and industry research for use in our investment models.
Communicate with other researchers, portfolio management, and trading desk to enhance research and portfolio management process.
Support senior individuals with client and marketing requests.
Work with moderate direction from Senior Research Analyst.
Qualifications - External
Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred.
3 to 6 years of investment experience preferred. Strong financial acumen and financial modeling skills '
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced/graduate degree preferred. (MFE, MBA, Master's/PhD in finance, accounting, economics, engineering, or similar field)
1 to 3 years of investment experience preferred.
Quantitative skills, including formal training in econometrics or statistics.
Strong programming skills preferred and an active interest in the application of computer technology to financial research and portfolio management.
Matlab, R and/or Python. Familiarity with SQL and noSQL desirable.
Must be able to work independently, have a strong sense of fundamental financial drivers.
