Location: San Francisco, CA 94104 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Description:
Job Description

The Investment Analyst’s primary responsibility is to help develop and implement impact investment strategies through the public markets including fixed income, equities, and alternatives. This role will require extensive portfolio management and asset allocation work in addition to public markets research (which includes alternatives). The Investment Analyst will work closely with the portfolio lead and the larger investment team to drive manager research and selection as well as support the management of customized managed accounts.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Be involved in all aspects of the investment process, including, among other things: o Daily qualitative and quantitative analysis required on investment managers and public markets.
Develop and maintain asset class universes populations in public markets and alternatives.
Support Sonen managed investment funds in public markets and alternatives.
Evaluate overall portfolio strategy, asset allocation and risk management as well as develop an understanding of underlying assets and portfolio exposures.
Generate monthly, quarterly and annual reports on products and clients’ portfolios, including presentations to internal investment committee, external partners, and directly with clients and prospects.
Assist and draft underwritings for investments.
Participate in manager calls and provide quick turnaround on notes and memoranda.
Research key macroeconomic themes and trends and complete other special projects as required.
Work closely with Sonen’s Head of Impact to conduct impact evaluations of funds and develop impact frameworks for strategies.
Support client service team to manage all aspects of client relationships.
Develop, enhance and maintain fund portfolio models
Work closely with marketing and business development team to prepare marketing materials including pitchbooks, DDQs, PPMs, due diligence binders and participate in marketing meetings.

Qualifications

The successful candidate will be an intellectually curious, self-motivated individual who is analytical, detail-oriented and has excellent oral and written communication skills.

Four-year degree required in finance, economics or a related field preferred.
MBA or CFA a plus but is not required.
At least 2 years of institutional investment experience a plus but not required.
Knowledge and experience of investing across public markets, including alternative strategies.
Flexible and able to work within a small team and company environment.
Strong note taking skills.
Need to have enthusiasm for the pace of public markets.
Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and Powerpoint.

Compensation and Benefits

Compensation is determined by a number of factors. We aim to ensure a rewarding mix of compensation, equity and comprehensive benefits.

Description
Job Summary:
SAIC is seeking a full time Documentation / Process Analyst to support a Cyber Security Modernization Program for a Federal Government Agency. This role is part of a larger cyber security modernization effort to review and re-engineer key administrative and business functions and processes, with an emphasis on IT Enterprise Asset Management. In this role, you will support the team with the development of process, template, and deliverable documentation. The candidate must be able to work independently and with a team.
This is a 100% remote role
Duties and Responsibilities:

Assess the operational and functional baseline of the organization and its organizational components as it relates to IT Asset Management (ITAM)
Help to define the direction and strategy while ensuring the organizational needs are being addressed
Create and maintain documentation for ITAM lifecycle elements with Technical Writing expertise,
Assist ITAM team with training documentation and deliverables
Assist ITAM team with reporting and documentation requirements
Support documenting the business process, workflows, and deliverables for multiple project areas
Perform analysis and review of data refinement to support efficient review and evaluation
Perform technical editing and formatting

Develop Visio diagrams, PowerPoint slide decks, deliverable, and data
Qualifications
Required Skills:
IT Process and procedures documentation and Technical Writing expertise
Policy documentation expertise
Expert with Microsoft Software Programs (Visio, Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Ability to understand requirements and their impact on technical directions of a solution
Ability to maintain professionalism and react to customers appropriately, while exhibiting the highest level of customer service
Ability to work independently and as a team member in a fast-paced development process
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong proofreading, grammar, and editing skills
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to develop, document, and ensure adherence to technical standards
Must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to sustain your own assigned project work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Ability to receive direction from multiple managers, and support multiple team members simultaneously
Ability to multitask
Must be highly organized and a self-starter
Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with team members and management
Must be flexible and willing to undertake a wide variety of challenging tasks
Strong facilitation skills.
Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders
Process driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods
Commitment to responsiveness and achieving tasks on deadline
Flexible team player

Desired Skills:
Federal Government experience
Knowledge and experience with inter-departmental government protocols and issues
ITIL v4 Fundamentals

Required Years of Experience/ Education:
Bachelor’s degree
5 years of experience

Additional Requirement(s):

Must be able to obtain a Public Trust
Must provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination
Physical Requirement(s): No Physical requirement needed for this position

Min. Citizenship Status Required: US Citizen


COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees will be required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Customer site vaccination requirements, if more strict, will take precedence over SAIC's vaccination policy.

Target salary range: $85,001 - $95,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.
SAIC® is a premier Fortune 500® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions.

We are more than 26,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com.

Job Purpose

The Quantitative Analyst will join the Quant Group which designs, implements, and supports enterprise quantitative models and systems. The primary role of this position will be to provide model study, data analysis, and strategic recommendations to solve practical problems in financial industry. The candidate for this job must have ability to work in a fast-paced environment, formulate and articulate solutions and defend assumptions. This role requires frequent interaction with Model Validators, Risk Managers, Developers and Senior Management.

Responsibilities

Review, interpret and validate results of quantitative model performance tests

Diagnose model result anomalies and recommend ways to improve model stability, reactivity, and quality

Develop analytical framework for model behavior investigations

Perform statistical analysis and calibration on quantitative model parameters and results in a systematic way

Provide documentations and/or presentations to illustrate methods, techniques, and findings for individuals with diverse professional backgrounds

Serve as a liaison between technology, operations, product management and the Financial Engineering team

Interact with large data sets and database architectures

Engage in innovative research tasks in the quantitative finance

Knowledge and Experience

Post Graduate degree in Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar required

Strong programming experience in Python, C/C++, R or Java

Basic SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases

Ability to work in a high-performance, high-velocity environment

Strong analytical and organizational skills with acute attention to detail

Strong communication skills

Customer focused and result oriented

Job Details
Description
CivicPlus is a high-growth technology company committed to creating more positive civic experiences. Inc. Magazine has selected CivicPlus as “One of the Fastest-Growing Privately Held Companies in the U.S.” since 2011.

 Headquartered in Manhattan, Kansas, CivicPlus maintains satellite offices in Marlborough, Massachusetts, Tallahassee, Florida, Portland, Oregon, and New Haven, Connecticut, and has remote staff nationwide. Across all our in-office and remote locations, we foster fun, fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative environments.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We believe that diversity drives innovation. The best companies, like the best communities, foster environments in which everyone feels safe to be themselves. We believe our workforce should reflect the communities we serve. We are committed to attracting and retaining those who share our mission of helping government work better through an employee development strategy built on equity and equal opportunity. We promise to foster a culture of inclusion where everyone feels respected, appreciated, and welcome so that together, we create technology to build a better community.

 We are looking for an experienced professional with a background in data analytics.

 We Offer You

The Marketing Strategy Analyst is responsible for assisting in the planning, development and execution of sales, retention and marketing strategies through reporting, analysis, client segmentation and list generation on a timely basis that drives revenue. This person is responsible for helping to grow revenue by assisting and collaborating with internal team members in the creation and execution of effective sales, retention and marketing programs.

 We’ll expect you to

Generate the appropriate quality lists to meet the target criteria for the programs.
Develop and perform the appropriate post campaign and segmentation analysis to improve the effectiveness of future campaigns and increase client sales.
Mine data to identify opportunities to improve customer retention and expand acquisition programs.
Utilize qualitative and quantitative analysis to continually identify trends, opportunities and risks applicable to the marketing/sales strategy
Provide and present actionable summaries of key findings to other department members on a consistent and proactive basis
Work cross-departmentally with other analysts to ensure data is shared and the ‘whole picture’ is considered.

What you'll need to succeed

A bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related field
At least two years of related experience
Must have knowledge of complex databases, report generation and maintenance tools
Advanced computer skills are required including Microsoft office applications
Must have strong analytical skills and a keen ability to translate the significance of complex findings to internal customers at all levels of the organization
Must be able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Individual must be highly proactive and able to lead projects, bringing them to successful implementation and completion.
Possess strong interpersonal skills along with excellent verbal and written communication abilities. Requires a passion for data and analysis and how it contributes to the overall goals
Exercises a fundamental willingness to learn, identify imaginative and resourceful solution to problems; thinks outside the box; knows there are better ways to do things and seeks opportunities to provide creative solutions, proactively

Employment Practices:

CivicPlus is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. At CivicPlus, we celebrate and support diversity for the benefit of our employees, products, clients and communities we serve.
Upon receiving an offer of employment, candidates must complete required pre-employment screenings, which include a drug test and background screen. Offer of employment is contingent upon this post offer screening process. All testing will be conducted by a licensed independent administrator, which will follow testing standards and background screens in accordance with state law.

BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies.

Bonus TypeDiscretionarySummary
At BOK Financial, our success starts with our incredible talent. Are you an experienced Data Integration Analyst who enjoys problem solving? This is an opportunity to become involved in some major transformative projects and leverage new cutting- edge technology. Bring your passion for technical support. It’s an exciting time to join us!About the Role
Without the expertise of our Senior Data Analysts, we would not be able to deliver superior services and products to our customers. This role offers an opportunity to build upon your existing skill set and learn new applications. You will be part of a highly-talented team of IT professionals that supports some of the most critical applications at the bank. You will also develop relationships with IT professionals across the bank and partner closely with the line of business. What You Can Expect
We are in a growth mode of our products and services, with a focus on our long-term technology roadmap. We will provide the objectives, and you will work with your manager to develop a plan on how to get there. Long term, IT offers multiple career paths. You have the ability to become an expert in your space or develop a diverse background supporting various areas across the bank. The decision is yours.Team Culture
Our team is committed to delivering the best IT data solutions for Wealth Management line of business. We collaborate with other IT members, as well as our business partners. It is a fast-paced, ever-changing yet fun environment with a number of new exciting initiatives. The mission of IT is to Enable Business Success and Create Raving fans. We do this through our shared quest to continuously improve, while simultaneously looking at ways to optimize our applications and processes. We are a determined, smart, and collaborative group that is eager to welcome you to the team.How You'll Spend Your Time

You will use your exceptional analysis and problem solving skills for data discovery, data validation, and data mapping.
You will apply your business acumen to help facilitate meetings and provide solutions for complex projects.
You will leverage your attention to detail to write functional business requirements and create reports from database repositories.
You will be responsible for complex systems process analysis, design, simulation, testing, implementation, application configuration, and deployments.
You will help mentor junior analysts.We'd Like to Talk to You

ATTENTION TO DETAIL: You must be thorough and accurate in your data analysis and solicitation of requirements to provide the best information.
TECHNICAL SKILLS: Your experience with complex SQL queries, solution design, system integration, and software development will help set you up for success, and your ability to troubleshoot and create detailed documentation is a plus.
COLLABORATIVE: You enjoy working in teams and across departments to achieve common goals.
RESULTS ORIENTED: You show initiative as you focus on the desired deliverables, while meeting and exceeding your goals.
PROBLEM SOLVER: You are able to track and solve complex problems in a variety of situations and function effectively in rapidly changing or uncertain conditions.Education & Experience Requirements
This level of knowledge is normally acquired through completion of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Technology and 3-5 years of directly related professional experience in MIS or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.

To engage with our recruiting assistant Olivia, visit our Career Site at jobs.bokf.com or text BOKF to 25000.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
To ensure compliance with President Biden’s September 9, 2021 executive order, Boeing is implementing a new requirement for U.S.-based employees to either show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved reasonable accommodation (based on a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief) exempting them from the requirement, by December 8, 2021 (timing may vary in some states). Individuals who are unable to meet COVID-19 requirements due to a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief may apply for a reasonable accommodation during the post-offer process. Individuals with approved accommodations will be subject to frequent COVID-19 testing.
Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exception by 3 December 2021. For Victorian based employees, the compliance date is 26 November 2021.
All other global Boeing locations do not have a vaccination requirement at this time.
Boeing Global Services (BGS) P-8 Reliability and Maintainability (R&M) team is seeking an experienced Systems Data Analyst 2 to join a dynamic team leading the way in R&M in Tukwila, WA . Our analysts work in a highly dynamic environment collecting data, analyzing data and making actionable recommendations to enable critical product improvements and support decisions. Our culture is open and inclusive. The work that you do matters! This position will represent the Sustainment organization to the United States Navy (NAVAIR/NAVSUP/DLA/CPRG), as well as Boeing Military Aircraft (BMA) and Boeing Commercial Airplanes (BCA) integrated product teams (IPTs), as well as international customers. A person in this position must have the ability to work under general direction.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform prime Reliability & Maintainability (R&M) analysis functions in support of our Navy R&M customer and the Reliability Control Board.

Perform data acquisition, management and reporting, to support design, maintenance, logistics, and business development throughout the product lifecycle.

Apply analysis results and make recommendations to product teams and system support/supportability, in order to influence design and comply with requirements.

Define, develop and implement processes and tools needed to execute system health functions and engineering supportability across the program and to improve productivity, accuracy, quality and efficiency.

Participate in change management activities to ensure compliance with design requirements and prepare proposal inputs to support new business opportunities.

Perform and document system health validation and verification activities, to assess adherence to specifications.

Qualified candidate researches, analyzes, and compiles technical data for company products and system-level concepts in the projected operational environments to optimize effectiveness over the program lifecycle.

Apply system processes, methodologies and tools to the design of system of systems, systems and new product development.

Derive and develop architectures, functional requirements, refinements and product designs.

Assists in the integration of technical, cost, value, risks and specialty engineering considerations into definition of the product. Interfaces with other members of the project or program teams, management, sales and marketing staff, customers and suppliers to meet group, organization and company objectives.

This position requires the ability to obtain an active U.S. Security Clearance. (A U.S. Security Clearance that has been active in the past 24 months is considered active.) An interim and/or final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required.

Export Control Requirement:
This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Proficiency with Microsoft Office

Experience with Naval Aviation Logistics Command Management Information System (NALCOMIS)

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's degree or higher

Microsoft Access and Visual Basic experience

Experience with Joint Deficiency Reporting System (JDRS)

Experience interacting with DECKPLATE

Knowledge/experience with U.S Navy NEC 6303, 6304, 6305, 6315, or 6314 is desirable.

P-8 mission and aircraft systems background

Proficiency navigating Boeing commercial maintenance manuals and/or USN IETMs

Proficiency interpreting maintenance action forms/work orders

Typical Education & Experience:
Technical bachelor's degree and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or a Master's degree with typically 3 or more years' or a PhD degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A technical degree is defined as any four year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study.

Relocation:
This position offers relocation to eligible candidates. This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.

Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

All information provided will be checked and may be verified.

Please apply ASAP for this role as recruitment may commence before the end date.

We are seeking a Quantitative Analyst in our Evanston office to join the Systematic Investing team. The analyst will develop investment models for a multi-strategy fund, working within a variety of markets, instruments and strategies. The ideal candidate will have experience in empirical finance and other quantitative techniques such as factor modeling and portfolio optimization. The candidate needs to be a team player with excellent communication skills, and able to perform and excel in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications
PhD in applied mathematics, quantitative finance, computer science, or related technical fields. 0-2 years of work experience is acceptable; 2-3 years of work experience is preferred.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent mathematical and modeling skills
Broad statistical toolkit including machine learning, econometrics, and non-parametric methods
Experience with factor modeling and portfolio optimization
Experience with statistical techniques in empirical finance
Strong programming skills in languages such as Matlab, Python, C++, and C#.

Ability to work in a high functioning environment

About Us

Magnetar Capital is a leading alternative asset manager with over $14 billion under management as of April 2021. We are conveniently headquartered in Evanston, Illinois – a suburb just north of Chicago – and are steps from the lakefront as well as a vibrant downtown area. We operate additional offices across the U.S. and UK.

We seek to generate consistent performance across a variety of market conditions by identifying differentiated investment ideas that we believe can be developed into scalable businesses. We invest across three core pillars: Alternative Credit & Fixed Income, Energy & Infrastructure and Systematic Investing.

When you join Magnetar, you will work alongside a diverse group of individuals who are among the best in the business at what they do. We attract highly skilled, dedicated professionals who enjoy working across practices and executing innovative ideas. Our employees have an intense level of intellectual curiosity, a profound passion for our work and care deeply about delivering results for the firm and for each other.

Our culture is based on the core values of insight, integrity and passion. We welcome unique backgrounds and perspectives, and work hard to foster an inclusive and welcoming environment where each of our employees feels empowered to thrive.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, our employees have transitioned to remote working, as their health and safety and that of their families is our top priority. We ensure each employee has the set-up and support they need to be productive from home, and take extra care in onboarding new team members to ensure they feel connected and supported by their colleagues from day one.

We know how important a healthy lifestyle is to our employees. When open, our offices provide employees with daily catered lunches at no cost and kitchens stocked with healthy snacks. We also have an onsite gym in our Evanston office and provide subsidized gym memberships for other office locations. While working remotely, our employees can take advantage of weekly virtual programming like fitness classes, cooking classes and mental health or parenting seminars.

Magnetar employees are passionate about philanthropy and we provide plenty of ways to give back. Through our Foundation, Magnetar invests heavily in increasing access to financial education through a best-in-class curriculum we co-created called finEDge. Employees can also take advantage of organized volunteer events and our company’s charitable match program.

Our employees enjoy exploring outside of the office too. Our unlimited paid time off policy, which includes unlimited vacation and sick days, as well as a competitive parental leave policy, gives employees time to rest and recharge.

We hope you’ll consider joining us as you explore careers at Magnetar!

Quantitative Analyst
The Department
This position is a member of the Systematic and Factor based Fixed Income investment team in Atlanta. Invesco’s Systematic and Factor Investing (SFI) team manages approximately $45 billion in systematic and factor investing strategies, across equity, fixed income, commodity, and multi-asset strategies, including over 175 custom indices managed by Invesco Indexing. The SFI team is based primarily in Atlanta, Boston, Frankfurt, and New York, with local support in offices around the globe. With live strategies dating back to 1983, Invesco has been at the forefront of quantitative and systematic investing in the industry, now with over 80 investment professionals dedicated to serving clients around the world.
Your Role
Functions this role is responsible for include model generation, strategy analysis, portfolio risk analysis, and integration of new and existing quantitative tools and databases.
You will be responsible for:
Working with the team to develop Invesco’s fixed income factor capabilities covering global corporate bonds, global government bonds and currencies into an industry leading position
Working with portfolio managers and other staff to develop or to enhance tools, techniques, and metrics for offering greater insights and perspective on portfolios to enhance value-add to clients
Helping manage information including data and other analytics
Participating in the development and evolution of alpha and portfolio construction strategies
Performing rigorous research and statistical analysis for all aspects of strategy development and ongoing management

The experience you bring:
Very strong analytical and mathematical skills including optimization techniques
Good coding skills with extensive hands-on experience in R, Python or other languages
Excellent working knowledge of econometrics and statistics including time series analysis
Proven track record of independently planning, coordinating, and executing quantitative research projects
Strong understanding of valuation and analytics in global credit, treasuries, structured securities included agency mortgages
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Team player who reliably and responsibly fulfills their area of responsibility
Advanced degree in quantitative (economics, finance or applied mathematics) field required (PHD, MBA, Master’s Degree, etc.) with demonstrated academic excellence

What’s in it for you?
Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our comprehensive compensation and benefit offerings including:
Flexible time off and opportunities for a flexible work schedule
401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with additional supplemental contribution
Health & wellbeing benefits
Parental Leave benefits
Employee stock purchase plan

THE OPPORTUNITY / RESPONSIBILITIES
Associate Data Science Analysts serve at the intersection of Business and Technology. The data science team undertakes large analytical projects involving classical statistics, machine learning, and model deployment via endpoints. The data science associates are involved in all steps of the data projects undertaken by the team, from the initial scoping of a project and exploratory analysis to the productionalization, presentation, and maintenance of the final output. You will also work closely with the Data Engineering team to construct and maintain the data pipelines necessary for our data science projects.
The ideal candidate is highly analytical, passionate about hypothesis-driven problem-solving, and excellent at developing data solutions, and requires strong communication skills, the ability to manage project scope and deadlines, and a commitment to delivering the highest quality in all projects. Analysts recognize that a collaborative mindset and a “can do” attitude is key in order to learn, contribute and grow at Scholastic. The role serves a range of functions across Scholastic’s businesses, covering financial analysis, customer analytics, web analytics, and analysis of offline activities.
WHO WE ARE
About Scholastic
Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of print and digital instructional materials for pre-K to grade 12, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs, classroom magazines and other products that, in combination, offer schools customized solutions to support children's learning both at school and at home. The Company also makes quality, affordable books available to all children through school-based book clubs and book fairs. With a 100+ year history of service to schools and families, Scholastic continues to carry out its commitment to "Open a World of Possible" for all children. Learn more at Scholastic.com/AboutScholastic.

Scholastic’s Technology Associate Program is designed to identify, train, and promote the next generation of leaders. Each new-hire class receives comprehensive training and is quickly given responsibility to deliver on business goals using industry-leading tools, partners, and technology – all while working in an agile, iterative model that emphasizes collaboration, transparency, and goal-oriented development.

Job Title: DATA ANALYST, Global Development Policy Center
Description:
The Boston University Global Development Policy (GDP) Center, a research center that focuses on policy-oriented research for financial stability, human well-being, and environmental sustainability across the globe, is seeking a Data Analyst to oversee its Global China Initiative’s Data Analysis for Transparency and Accountability (D.A.T.A.) project. This project seeks to increase the transparency of Chinese economic activity across the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) so that host country governments, Chinese policymakers, scholars, journalists, and civil society organizations can engage in more empirical-based discourse and action agenda geared toward greening the BRI.


The Data Analyst will be responsible for maintaining the GDP Center’s suite of databases, which currently includes the following: China’s Overseas Development Finance (CODF) Database; China’s Global Energy Finance (CGEF) Database; China’s Global Power (CGP) Database; China-Latin America Finance (CLAF) Database; and China-Africa Loans (CALD) Database.


The Data Analyst will work closely with PIs and research leads to identify, review, and integrate external data sources into GDP Center data; collaborate with the research teams in the conduct of the collection of data across the Center's various databases; clean, verify, and manage data input.


The Data Analyst will work across functional teams and with external consultants on the design and presentation of interactive data visualizations.


Responsibilities:

Data management, including extraction and cleaning of raw data from primary and secondary sources.
Derivation of new variables, labeling and formatting of raw and derived variables, and multiple imputation.
Identify and troubleshoot coding errors.
Document processes involved in data preparation, manipulation, and analysis.
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Extract information from the datasets and the Center’s databases for inclusion in reports to internal and external audiences.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills

STATA required
Experience in R strongly preferred
A bachelor's degree is required; a master's degree is preferred
3-5 years related work experience


This is position is for a two-year appointment and is subject to periodic performance reviews. Potential renewal is contingent upon funding availability.

Job Title: Finance Data Analyst, Devices and Services
Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in financial planning and analysis (FP&A), consulting, or a related function.
Experience in Business Intelligence (BI), data science, data engineering, or related technology field.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience building analytical solutions (e.g. project identification, design, deployment, monitoring and support).
Experience with programming languages and statistical packages (e.g. R, Python, MATLAB).
Experience working with version control environments.
About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.

In Devices and Services (D&S) Central Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A), our goal is to increase access to data and insights, and scale FP&A work with business growth.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on a growing business. As a Finance Data Analyst for the D&S Finance team, you will be responsible for a variety of critical initiatives, including structuring new financial data-sets, building/supporting complex reporting and analytics, and managing project engagements with Finance and other Google engineering teams. Your work will require both direct coding/development as well as stakeholder management and project management. You will have significant exposure to Finance leadership and will coordinate closely across all Google devices.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Deliver consistent and robust financial reporting and business insights across Devices and Services products.
Plan, prioritize, and maintain data and reporting solutions for Devices and Services Finance and Business stakeholders.
Partner with Engineering to shape Devices and Services systems, including business intelligence, reporting, and analytics platforms.
Partner closely with cross-functional teams to improve existing reporting infrastructure and thought partner on reporting for the future.

CB Insights is looking for a motivated Community Lead to help manage communications with enterprise-facing companies. You'll have the opportunity to act as the face and voice of our brand.

The role you'll play:

The Research Products team is in the process of building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program. The program aims to provide companies with an opportunity to present their products, services, and business strategies to our analysts who cover the technology market - via surveys and phone calls.

As a CB Insights Community Lead, you will set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies with enterprise-facing companies. Further, you will be tasked with identifying appropriate contacts, driving survey participation rates, and building relationships, in effort to generate rich data that our research team and clients can use.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly ten years of experience in surveying companies and creating research products. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products. One primary focus this year is building out CB Insights Analyst Briefing program - you can expect to hone in on your communication skills and attention to detail, as you assist the team in initial outreach and ongoing communications with 1000's of enterprise-facing companies.

Your main tasks:

Identify companies focused on selling to enterprise customers
Create contact lists
Set, plan, and implement the team's communication campaigns and strategies using Qualtrics, Outreach, and other engagement platforms
Test and optimize marketing and outreach tactics to increase survey participation rates
Respond to company queries in a timely manner
Build relationships with analyst relation teams and executives across dozens of industries
Ensure our analysts have the necessary materials from companies when producing research
Liaise between companies and our research team
Liaise with our marketing and PR teams

BA / BS
Excellent verbal communication skills over both phone and email
Excellent writing skills
Ability to multitask and work independently
Solid attention to detail, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Experience planning and leading community initiatives
Ability to identify and track relevant community KPIs
Experience with MS Office apps, Google apps, and Salesforce
Experience with survey tools, such as Qualtrics (preferable, not required)

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

We are looking for individuals who love numbers and data and obsess about different ways to approach a problem or gain insight into operational challenges using data. We want people who can run intricate models with ease for all types of common and uncommon information. Do you look at a problem and immediately think about how to provide solutions using the data at hand? Do you see trends in data and make connections that others do not automatically identify? If so, this is the perfect job for you! We need someone who can think critically; who understands both the content and the context of analytical models and can explain the "why" along with the "how." We do not want you to just run numbers; we want you to use your knowledge and models to illustrate everything we aren't thinking about because we are not as skilled as you in analytics.

ABOUT OUR FIRM

Blue Cottage of CannonDesign is an industry-leading consulting firm. Our team works with organizational leaders to define their ideal future and plan processes, organizational strategies, equipment and facilities to create an ideal future, and our projects are anchored by any of the following services: strategic transformation, design thinking, space and functional programming, operational planning, change management, and transition and activation planning.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Consulting Analyst is responsible primarily for working with project leadership and other project staff to support all aspects of planning, preparation, coordination, and execution of projects.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Support project staff and project leadership in all aspects of planning, preparation, coordination, and execution of a project and anticipation of needs as driven by project work plans.
Produce project documentation, research briefs, meeting materials, data analysis, graphics, best practice presentations, benchmark info and interim and final deliverables.
Significant travel may be required.

ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

Qualified candidates must have a Bachelor's degree by hire date.
Demonstrated ability to work in PowerPoint, create detailed workflows in Visio, and quantitative strengths in the creation of detailed analytical models using Excel and various tool is a must.
Experience and wizardry in visualization of data using Tableau, PowerBi, or similar tools preferred.
Candidate must have the ability to work independently and to manage multiple tasks in a time-sensitive environment.
Production of thought leadership papers, presentations, blogs, case studies, and presence at national conferences/meetings are preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.

ABOUT WORKING WITH BLUE COTTAGE OF CANNONDESIGN

We are a start-up culture in an established firm: nimble, energetic, innovative and fun.
We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our Diversity + Inclusion Council, Women's Forum, and other community advocacy initiatives.
We're about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we're ready for you!

The salary range for this position is $55,000 to $75,000 annually. Employees may be eligible for discretionary bonuses. We offer a full benefit package including medical, dental and vision coverage and flexible spending account options and voluntary insurances. We have paid time off, flex-time summer hours, remote work options and a 401k plan and employee perk programs. For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/.

Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.

As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.

CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

Job Title: Cyber and Intelligence Solutions Associate Analyst, Masterca...
Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Cyber and Intelligence Solutions Associate Analyst, Mastercard Launch (2022)
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments network. We are a worldwide vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a leading technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you and aim to connect everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.


The Cyber and Intelligence Solutions team is responsible for innovation, development and management of our products and services to address evolving risk and security needs for all of Mastercard’s customers across the world including Banks, Merchants, Fintechs and of course consumers. The 18 month rotational program is comprised of rotation placements across Mastercard’s cyber and information security business. Some of the potential rotations include:

Working with our Fraud teams to build data models to identify breached merchants, and make any credit card data stolen worthless to hackers.
Work with our intelligence teams to identify new tactics, techniques and procedures, and build solutions to protect our customers from emerging cyber threats.
Work with global product teams to execute commercialization initiatives, including establishing go-to-market and expansion plans along with key performance indicators for cyber and intelligence products.

Role:

Conduct analysis of transaction level data to develop new ways of detecting fraud
Build systems to be used by global banking networks to detect cyber attacks
Leverage AI models to provide automated transaction risk decisions
Reverse engineer cyber-attacks on payment technologies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build defense strategies
Research and assess market and customer needs for product development
Develop business cases through research and quantification of strategic opportunities

All about you:

Graduating senior pursuing Bachelor’s/Accelerated Master’s Degree
Passion for Cybersecurity and profound interest in learning new tools, threat vectors, attack techniques, technologies, and best practices in preventing against cybersecurity incidents
Familiarity with cybersecurity landscape and major threats and trends that have garnered industry attention
Strong interest in current affairs and news media
Coursework in Applied Mathematics or Statistics
Data and analytics – understanding of statistical analysis predictive modeling, aptitude in displaying and communicating data analysis , and desire to conduct data-driven experiments and create data-driven products
Strong oral and written communication skills (presentations, publishing papers, blogs)
Self-starter with passion for solving problems
High energy level; flexible, adaptive and strong collaborator
Well planned, organized & structured to manage time & work effectively

Program Details:

Mastercard’s New Hire Program (Launch) is aimed at bright, driven and adaptable undergraduate students. It’s an 18-month rotation program that provides emerging professionals development, support and enhanced work experiences to accelerate and drive professional growth. Hires in this Specialist Track of Launch will deepen their subject matter expertise through rotations across Mastercard.


The program is open to:

Graduating seniors - Class of 2022
Minimum overall GPA of 3.5

Cover letter is required for this role
Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.
Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.
Corporate Security Responsibility

Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and therefore, it is expected that the successful candidate for this position must:


• Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;

• Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;

• Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and

• Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Quantitative Analyst
The Department
This position is a member of the Systematic and Factor based Fixed Income investment team in Atlanta. Invesco’s Systematic and Factor Investing (SFI) team manages approximately $45 billion in systematic and factor investing strategies, across equity, fixed income, commodity, and multi-asset strategies, including over 175 custom indices managed by Invesco Indexing. The SFI team is based primarily in Atlanta, Boston, Frankfurt, and New York, with local support in offices around the globe. With live strategies dating back to 1983, Invesco has been at the forefront of quantitative and systematic investing in the industry, now with over 80 investment professionals dedicated to serving clients around the world.
Your Role
Functions this role is responsible for include model generation, strategy analysis, portfolio risk analysis, and integration of new and existing quantitative tools and databases.
You will be responsible for:
Working with the team to develop Invesco’s fixed income factor capabilities covering global corporate bonds, global government bonds and currencies into an industry leading position
Working with portfolio managers and other staff to develop or to enhance tools, techniques, and metrics for offering greater insights and perspective on portfolios to enhance value-add to clients
Helping manage information including data and other analytics
Participating in the development and evolution of alpha and portfolio construction strategies
Performing rigorous research and statistical analysis for all aspects of strategy development and ongoing management

The experience you bring:
Very strong analytical and mathematical skills including optimization techniques
Good coding skills with extensive hands-on experience in R, Python or other languages
Excellent working knowledge of econometrics and statistics including time series analysis
Proven track record of independently planning, coordinating, and executing quantitative research projects
Strong understanding of valuation and analytics in global credit, treasuries, structured securities included agency mortgages
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Team player who reliably and responsibly fulfills their area of responsibility
Advanced degree in quantitative (economics, finance or applied mathematics) field required (PHD, MBA, Master’s Degree, etc.) with demonstrated academic excellence

What’s in it for you?
Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our comprehensive compensation and benefit offerings including:
Flexible time off and opportunities for a flexible work schedule
401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with additional supplemental contribution
Health & wellbeing benefits
Parental Leave benefits
Employee stock purchase plan

Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.

Overview

As part of the Survey and Qualitative Methods Core (SQMC) at the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (DFCI) and the Dana-Farber / Harvard Cancer Center (DFHCC), the SQMC Data Analyst supports small to large scale community, health services, and implementation science research projects that use survey, qualitative, and secondary data sources. This position works under the supervision of the Director and Scientists of the SQMC and follows established policies and procedures in order to support the data acquisition, processing, and management needs for studies that use the SQMC services. The Data Analyst also facilitates regulatory requirements for data acquisition and management, such as institutional review board protocols and Data Use Agreements, and enrollment reporting to external and internal stakeholder, as applicable.

Requirements

Analyzes secondary data (e.g. Electronic Health Records, federal and state-wide surveys).
Retrieves and processes non-research data according to research protocol.
Facilitates regulatory requirements for data acquisition and management. Interacts with the Institutional Review Board (IRB) for protocol submission and continuing reviews.
Attends and contributes to research in progress meetings.
Maintains a complete record of research activities and results in a reproducible manner.
Performs other duties, as assigned.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, or quantitative field with relevant course or project work.
Experience coding in R, producing reproducible data products, and data visualizations.
Excellent programming skills, particularly in R.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work on a team.
Good oral and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize a variety of tasks.
Careful attention to detail.
Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect for research participants’ rights and individual needs.

Tesla is seeking a motivated, experienced, and knowledgeable Data Analyst to support Global and Regional Distribution Center operations. You will work cross-functionally with Global Supply Chain, Logistics, Material Planning, Service, Finance, Quality and Facilities to collect, measure, visualize and interpret data; to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize the Distribution Center’s operational effectiveness and efficiency.Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.Uses data patterns and trends to root cause operational gaps and inefficiency, develop solutions in collaboration with operations teams.Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.Work with Distribution Center and Supply Chain leadership to prioritize business and information needs.Identify and define new process improvement opportunities.
Requirements:
3+ years working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) an interactive dashboards.Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.Initiative to gain and implement a broad knowledge of warehousing and supply chain best practices.BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or related field.

Job Title: Data Analyst - TikTok US - Tech Services
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity, celebrate individuality and bring people together. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

The Data Analytics team of the US Tech Service department at TikTok is responsible for building high-quality and timely data solutions for the business as the single source of truth and for building easy-to-use and scalable data products to support business growth. You will have the exciting opportunity to:


Design and monitor core metrics; understand root causes of metric movements
Design and build advanced analytical solutions and products to deliver superior business outcomes using research and performing quantitative and qualitative analysis
Identify trends and opportunities to drive product growth and nurture a healthy ecosystem
Understand underlying data sources and their limitations and communicate complex data insights through exploratory analysis and research to suggest improvement
2+ years of experience in BI, Data Analytics, and Data Science.
Experience with SQL, ETL, R/Python.
Experience navigating and working with very large data sets and developing large and complex data pipelines using SQL/HQL
Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, Looker)
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, learn autonomously, and highly organized
Ability to conduct rigorous analysis and communicate conclusions to both technical and non-technical audiences.
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com

Apply Statistical and Machine Learning methods to specific business problems and data.Ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including such areas as data sourcing/collection, ground truth generation, normalization, transformation, cross-lingual alignment/mapping, etc.Design, develop, evaluate, and release highly innovative models elevate the customer experience and track impact over timeCollaborate with colleagues from multidisciplinary science, engineering and business backgrounds.Work with engineers to develop efficient data querying and modelling infrastructure for both offline and online use casesManage your own process: identify and execute on high impact projects, triage external requests, and make sure you bring projects to conclusion in time for the results to be usefulCommunicate proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions to drive business decisionsUsing tools such as Tableau, Looker and GoogleData Studio to aggregate data from across our software tools to build and develop dashboards for both client-facing and internal purposes across the company that feature relevant KPIs and metricsCreate data dashboards and other data visualization tools to track progress to inform continuous quality improvement of the Congregate Settings Investigation and Response Unit.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary, InternshipPay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Data analysis skills: 1 year (Required)Work Location: Remote

The Role

Data is at the heart and core of Affinity's business and our lean, mean, data team needs a passionate Marketing Data Analyst who will work hand in hand with the marketing team to deliver data insights across the marketing funnel. You will be pivotal in finding insights and opportunities from our various compelling data sources that will help us continue growing. What's more, you won't only show up to excel at what you do, but also to be key in influencing a world where anyone can cultivate and fully harness their network to succeed.

What will I be doing?:

Collaborate with the marketing team to measure the performance of marketing investments from top of funnel to deals and expansion
Identify and analyze varied types of marketing data (web traffic, ad channel data, campaign metrics, etc.) to discover trends and patterns
Automate and manage complex ETL/ELT jobs to a data warehouse
Effectively visualize data in a meaningful and informative way
Propose recommendations and findings based on your analyses to business leaders, executives, and key stakeholders
Establish KPIs that help track the health of our business
Where beneficial to the business, build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Uphold high standards of data ethics and the responsible use of data
Work with our stack:
Data Warehouse: Amazon Redshift
ETL/ELT: dbt, Stitch
BI: Looker, Amplitude

Qualifications

Required:

3+ years of experience as a Marketing Data Analyst
Good understanding of data and technology from the marketing technology stack, from google analytics, to marketing automation, to lead routing
Exceptional SQL skills
Experience creating complex Transform jobs to cleanup and aggregate data
Analytical mindset and business acumen
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience with:
Business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Amplitude)
Data warehouses (e.g. Redshift, PostgreSQL)

Bonus points for:

Experience with:
ETL/ELT orchestration tools (dbt, Stitch, Fivetran, Airflow)
Github
Knowledge of R, Python
Experience writing and instrumenting ETL or ELT jobs in Python

What you'll enjoy at Affinity

We live our values as playmakers who are obsessed with learning, care personally about our colleagues and clients, are radically open-minded, and take pride in everything we do.
We pay your medical, dental, and vision insurance with comprehensive PPO and HMO plans. And provide flexible personal & sick days. We want our team to be happy and healthy :)
We offer a 401k plan to help you plan for retirement.
We provide an annual budget for you to spend on education and offer a comprehensive L&D program – after all, one of our core values is that we're #obsessedwithlearning!
We support our employee's overall health and well-being and reimburse monthly for things such as; Transportation, Home Internet, Meals, and Wellness memberships/equipment.
Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is essential.

About Us

At Affinity, we are passionate about helping dealmakers in the world's biggest relationship-driven industries to find, manage, and close the most important deals. Our Relationship Intelligence platform uses the data exhaust of trillions of interactions between Investment Bankers, Venture Capitalists, Consultants, and other strategic dealmakers with their networks to deliver automated relationship insights that drive over 450,000 deals every month. We have raised over $120M and are backed by some of Silicon Valley's best firms. With over 1700 customers in 70 countries on our platform, a Glassdoor rating of 4.9, and being ranked in the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies, we need more great people to help us scale even more.

The more diverse our team is, the more we'll be able to learn from each other, and the better our company and our product will be. Whatever your gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, veteran status, favorite Spotify playlist, or social, cultural, and economic background, we can't wait to welcome you to Affinity!

Consumer Insights Analysts (CIA) produce analysis and reporting which enable stakeholders to develop and refine strategies and tactics to meet customer needs, increase Publix customer satisfaction and loyalty, and maximize sales and profits. This includes providing key support on custom research studies (primary and some secondary) from conception through final presentation. The CIA’s work is overseen by a Consumer Insights Project Manager. The Consumer Insights Analysts report to the Manager of Consumer Insights.

Additional responsibilities include:

providing analytical and logistical project support on consumer insights research projects that are led by a Consumer Insights Project Manager (CIPM) in order to ensure the accomplishment of key milestones and delivery against project scopeassisting the Consumer Insights Project Managers/Senior PMs in the design and development of assigned consumer insights research projects from project scope development through presenting final resultsproviding key support to other associates on the Consumer Insights team for producing research reports, recommendation documents, position papers, presentations and other key deliverablesconducting ad hoc and post hoc (statistical) analyses on custom and/or tracking studies in order to fully leverage data sources and uncover key insightsongoing management and maintenance of a proprietary online customer panel of Publix customers who have been invited to join a community with the intent of providing Publix with feedback on our products and servicesmonitoring secondary research sources and integrating research study findings as it pertains to the custom studies being conducteddedicating time to Marketing innovation and quality improvementmanaging special Marketing related assignments, which can include but is not limited to: project management, executing reporting and presenting results to executive leadership Willingness to work in the department's office location at Publix corporate headquarters in Lakeland, Florida.
Required Qualifications: • Bachelor of Science Degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Sociology, Mathematics, Statistics, Anthropology, Psychology, or equivalent experience
knowledge of statistics, quantitative methods, and data analysis (including descriptive, multivariate, and nonparametric statistics)knowledge of statistical software (SPSS, MiniTab, SAS, or R) and statistical functions in Microsoft Office program (Excel)quantitative and qualitative data analysis skillsanalytical and critical thinking skillsproject management skillsability to work independently with minimal supervisionexcellent written and verbal communication skills, and presentation skillsprofessionalism/strong interpersonal skillsteamwork and collaboration skillswillingness to act with professionalism, poise, and discipline when approach, methodology or chosen data visualization method is challenged by the CIPM or other Consumer Insights associatesflexibility and adaptability, willingness to respond to quickly changing priorities on short noticeoccasional travel (approximately 4-6 times/year) to observe/conduct primary research or for competitive and/or Publix store visitsability to work a variable work schedule as needed including nights, holidays, weekends, and extended hours to meet deadlines
Address: 3300 Publix Corporate Parkway

Job Title: Entry Level - Masters Degree Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About GM

There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including openwork spacesand virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteerinterests,andmake it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

General Motorshasan exciting opportunity forrecentcollege graduateswho are technical, innovative, problem solverstoapply toour Analytics Career Evolution (ACE)development program.

Employees hired intothe ACE program willhave an opportunity toacceleratetheirprofessionalexperienceand expand their networkbyworkingacross severalareas of GMfor the fewyearsoftheiremployment.The ACE development program will provide a vast number ofexciting projects, visibility to senior leadership, robusttraining,and networking opportunities.

At the end of thedevelopmentprogram,ACEemployees willhave an opportunity to work withACEprogram leaders and human resources to find their next role within general motors.In anticipation of these opportunities becoming available, if you are interested in learning more about GM, completing this profile will allow us to stay connected.

If you share our passion for reimagining transportation and creating a safer,betterand more sustainable future, we encourage you to learn more about our available positions and apply today!

Weare looking for DataAnalystprofessionals who:

Have a steadfast drive for excellence

Challenge themselves and their peers

Enjoy working collaboratively in cross-functional teams

Demonstrate a good work ethic

Have a strong ability and willingness to learn
Exhibit curiosity and are willing to explore new possibilities and solutions

Understand advanced math and analytics concepts, andcanapply them to real applications

Desire to deliver innovative solutions to complex problems

Role -as a Data Analyst, they support operational improvement and business decision making through ad-hoc statistical analysis of curated enterprise data and self-constructed data sets. Data Analysts collaborate closely with business leaders, IT partners, and other analysts to develop new and unique data-driven solutions using Big Data platforms, creative analytical methods, and data visualization techniques.

Additional Job Description

Requirements:

Education:Master'sdegree - Mathematics, Computer Science,Statistics,Economics, Social Science,or other quantitative degree preferred

Preferred academic or work experience in a data-intensive field/industry such as biotechnology, computational chemistry, cognitive or neurosciences, behavioral economics, econometrics, engineering, physics, quantitative finance, high frequency trading or intelligence analytics

Job locations will be in Warren or Detroit, Michigan; some roles will consider remote work

Technical Experience (or exposure to):

Big data tools such as Hadoop, Greenplum, Spark, Hue, and Knime

Business intelligence and data visualization tools including PowerBI, Excel, and Cognos.

Proficiency in one of the following programming languages is desired: Python, R, Postgres, and HQL/SQL

Knowledgeable of statistical methods such as regression, probability analysis, risk analysis, statistical process control, and clustering is desired
This role offers the followingWork Appropriatelystrategies:

Remote: The selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.
Hybrid:This position does not require an employee to be onsite full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.
Relocation assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements.
