Job Title: Financial Analyst, Google Cloud and Technical Infrastructure
Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience in management and strategy consulting, data analysis, or financial services.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience with SQL.
Effective partnership and influencing skills during daily interactions with senior leaders in Sales, Finance, and Strategy and Operations teams.
Effective problem solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business acumen and strategic thinking.
Effective communication and presentation skills to deliver findings of analysis and recommendations to stakeholders.
Effective financial modeling skills and ability to understand trends in data, build forecasts, develop insights and turn them into strategies with high impact.
Ability to take initiative and work independently in an unstructured, fast-changing environment. Ability to comfortably handle ambiguity and make decisions.
About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.

Google’s Cloud Platform (GCP) is enhancing the way the world accesses compute power and GCP is a fast growing product at Google. As a member of Google Cloud Finance, you will work with your cross-functional partners who value the impact and influence that Finance brings to the table and who leverage our insights to make the most strategic decisions.
Google’s Technical Infrastructure (TI) Finance team helps Google meet customer demand for its products and compute and networking capacity. We work with the TI business to manage our spend trajectory and allocate resources efficiently in order to maximize the economic benefit to Alphabet. We work closely with the team that builds and operates Google Technical Infrastructure around the world. Our business partners design and implement the infrastructure all Google’s products rely upon to deliver the Google experience to users worldwide.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Use Google’s big data and creativity to architect metrics, report on the health of business, forecast future performance, and analyze opportunities.
Deliver insights into drivers of growth, costs, user metrics, and market trends. Identify risks and opportunities with actionable recommendations.
Lead decision making on resource allocations for products and business investments, identify key market drivers that lead to growth.
Partner with business leadership to establish vision for the business and collaborate with cross-functional teams to pursue growth strategies.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

As the world's leading provider of cloud-based software and technology solutions delivered by managed service providers (MSPs), Datto believes there is no limit to what small and medium businesses can achieve with the right technology. Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. These partners provide Datto solutions to over one million businesses across the globe. Since its founding in 2007, Datto continues to win awards each year for its rapid growth, product excellence, superior technical support, and for fostering an outstanding workplace. With headquarters in Norwalk, Connecticut, Datto has global offices in the United Kingdom, Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, Canada, Australia, China, and Singapore. Learn more at datto.com.

As a member of the Business Analytics and Insights team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will use technical and business knowledge to develop reporting of key performance indicators to support various business operations across the department. This position is focused on developing reporting metrics and preparing data analyses around our business continuity products. This role requires candidates to have an understanding of Tableau and Python (or similar tools). This position will also work with the BI Manager to understand internal data structures to best facilitate accessing and making data available to make business decisions.

The BI Analyst will perform data source creation across several disparate data sources. Additionally, this role will also have responsibility for ongoing efficiency reporting through the merging of data sources. The role will aid in the delivery of customer experience metrics and provide recommendations in the presentation of data.

A Look Inside the Job:

Translate business needs into research designs that generate actionable insights through professional reporting formats (presentation or written)
Leverage Datto technology and process knowledge to make recommendations
Identify trends within our continuity product data from purchasing trends, device utilization, error logs, and technical support data
Disseminate results of analysis to appropriate teams/leadership and be available to support follow up projects
Work with BI Manager to identify and measure successful and failing strategies and identify opportunities for process improvement

About You:

Bachelor's degree and 2+ years of relevant experience
Advanced SQL and Excel knowledge
Intermediate Tableau experience (or similar software)
Ability to implement statistical analysis/modeling through Python (or SPSS/R/etc.)
Previous experience working with ElasticSearch data preferred
Expertise in analyzing and packaging large amounts of data into actionable research reports
Advanced analytical/problem solving and research skills
Effective communication skills for writing reports/proposals and supporting presentations
Benefits:
At Datto, we're committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including:
Comprehensive health-care benefits
Flexible paid time off policy
Generous paid paternal leave
"Datto University" virtual on-boarding program
Access to more than 5,000 courses via LinkedIn Learning
Education reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program
Headspace App
Charity match program
A dynamic and socially active work culture, including Employee Resource Groups
Networking and career development opportunities
And more!
Note: We are looking only for candidates willing to join us directly as W2 employees (No 3rd party candidates)

Job summary
Are you excited to make a difference and help launch a new GTM as we expand the success of running critical ERP workloads on AWS to Oracle applications? Are you excited about the cloud computing industry and leveraging cutting edge data analytics technologies and methodologies? Do you want to work in a leading edge Specialized Sales and Business Development team focused on helping customers, AWS, and partners to build compelling business cases to move to AWS, take actions to drive the most value from their AWS investment, and measure the value realized?

AWS Sales is seeking a Specialized Sales Operations Analyst to work with the Worldwide regions including; APAC, EMEA, US, and Japan Specialized Sales teams, to analyze business performance and make business recommendations to senior management - all in an environment of rapid growth. This will include working with the Specialized Sales leadership to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives. In this role, this person will work closely with members of the sales and business development teams to ensure the team is capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions, across the global program.

This person will be working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. Along with driving towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, utilizing project-management skills, and communicating complex analytical results, both written and verbally.

This position can be remote remote Amazon but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Sunnyvale, Santa Monica, Seattle).


Advanced experience in dashboarding, data visualization, and reporting tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight
3+ years advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Macros, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc)
Experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database
Proven experience working with sales systems and tools such as CRM, variable compensation, and revenue reporting
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of supporting a variety of stakeholders
Exhibits sound business judgment and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and providing clear answers to complex problems
Experience with business-process design
Experience working within a high-growth, technology company
Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
Strong problem solving and collaboration skills
Experience in prioritization of deliverables and tasks
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Deloitte's Strategy team architect's programs that transform our clients' businesses. To do this, we have assembled a practice of leading business and technology strategy experts that each contribute unique capabilities and insights - including Corporate & Business Unit Strategy, Strategy Execution, Growth Transformation, Technology Strategy & Insights, Enterprise Model Design, Enterprise Cloud Strategy, and Business Transformation.


Strategy professionals serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear, data-driven choices about where to play and how to win in order to drive growth and unlock enterprise value.


Strategy helps our clients:

Identify strategies for growth and value creation
Develop the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision
Maximize the ROI on technology investments and leverage technology and Cloud trends to architect future business strategies.


Qualifications


Required:


1+ year of prior experience in a research or business analyst role
Undergraduate degree with a focus in economics, engineering, finance or accounting preferred
Outstanding academic achievement and demonstrated leadership
An interest in consulting and/or investment management
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to build Excel-based financial and operating models a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
A passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing
A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 50% (While 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)


Preferred:
Ability to define trends across industries and articulate their impact to clients' business and strategic choices
Knowledge of or experience in broader G&A functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations
Exposure to customer journey maps - must be able to understand customer journeys, consumer behavior, including engagement with digital channel
Basic understanding of the core digital technologies that underpin world class customer experiences (e.g. CRM, E-Commerce, Content Management)
Experience creating road maps and detailed financial business cases for change
Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support
Past experiences should include customer journey mapping, primary customer research, solution design, roadmap development, business case development
Advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program



Strategy_Consulting21

THE POSITION
Looking for a rewarding job making a difference in the lives of children? Join the Office of Children, Youth and Families team! As a member of our team, you’ll be part of a diverse network that supports and strengthens families in Pennsylvania to provide safe, nurturing and healthy environments for children. The work is challenging, but extremely rewarding! There are opportunities for professional development and growth AND free parking!
DESCRIPTION OF WORK
This position is part of the Systems and Data Management Section within the Bureau of Policy, Programs and Operations, and is part of a team of Business Analysts responsible for supporting the program offices in the planning, development, implementation and operation of information systems for the programs administered and supervised by OCYF.

The Systems and Data Management Section manages the existing Child Welfare Information Solution (CWIS) and is responsible for providing leadership and direction for the planning, development and implementation of a new Statewide Child Welfare Case Management System. The Section also manages other legacy applications for the office and is responsible for data management, data quality, and reporting.

The person in this position will perform analysis of county and/or state business processes and requirements that will be supported in a new case management system. Additional job duties are to include engaging users in business process reengineering and user stories, participating in the design and development of the case management system, performing user acceptance testing, and providing implementation support (training and technical assistance).

A portion of the person’s time may also include providing child welfare and OCYF procedural expertise for operational support and technical assistance for the following systems and processes: DocuShare, Account Administration (Business Partner account/technical assistance), Continuity of Operations, CWIS (Child Welfare Information System), and management of the CWIS County Helpdesk Resource Account.

The work also involves representing the program office and providing child welfare expertise in the identification and documentation of existing business processes, and in the development and implementation of improved business processes for their application to an IT system in support of agency programs and policy.

Work Hours and Additional Information:
Full time employment.
Work hours: 8:00 am - 4:30 pm, Monday - Friday with 1 hour lunch.
You will have the opportunity to work from home (telework), part-time up to 4 days a week. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY
Qualifications:
Minimum Experience and Training Requirements - One year as a Business Analyst 1; OR one year as an Information Technology Trainee; OR one year of business process analysis experience and a bachelor’s degree; OR five years of business process analysis experience; OR an equivalent combination of experience and training.
Must meet PA residency requirement – For more information on ways to meet PA residency requirements, follow the link and click on Residency.
Do not submit resumes, cover letters, and similar documents. These documents will not be reviewed and the information contained therein will not be considered for the purposes of determining your eligibility for the position or to determine your score. Information to support your eligibility for the position must be provided on the application (i.e., relevant, detailed experience/education).
If you are claiming education in your answers to the supplemental application questions, you must attach a copy of your college transcripts for your claim to be accepted toward meeting the minimum requirements. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable.
Must be able to perform essential job functions.
Veterans: Pennsylvania law (51 Pa. C.S. §7103) provides employment preference for qualified veterans for appointment to many state and local government jobs. To learn more about employment preferences for veterans, go to www.employment.pa.gov/Additional%20Info/Pages/default.aspx and click the Veterans’ Preference tab or contact us at ra-cs-vetpreference@pa.gov.

 Telecommunications Relay Service (TRS): 711 (hearing and speech disabilities or other individuals)

The Commonwealth does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, ancestry, union membership, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, AIDS or HIV status, disability, or any other categories protected by applicable federal or state law. All diverse candidates are encouraged to apply.
EXAMINATION INFORMATION
Completing the application, including all supplemental questions, serves as your exam for this position. No additional exam is required at a test center (also referred to as a written exam).
Your score is based on the detailed information you provide on your application and in response to the supplemental questions.
Your score is valid for this specific posting only.

your score may be lower than deserved.
you may be disqualified.

Your results will be provided via email.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including health coverage, vision, dental, and wellness programs.*

Work/Life Balance
We understand that there is more to life than work – and we want you to enjoy it!
For most positions, we offer paid vacation days, paid sick days, military leave, as well as paid time off for most major U.S. holidays. Alternate work schedules are available for certain positions.

We want to help you grow and see your goals become a reality! Employees can easily transfer between positions or agencies to expand knowledge and pursue new challenges while retaining leave and benefits. Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.
Join us. Shape your story here.
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
This is our story.
We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.
See what it’s like to work at CNN! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.
The Job
The CNN Research team is looking for an analyst to support CNN's content development and non-fiction programming. We blend primary and secondary research to inform a variety of internal stakeholders with strategic insights including the executive team. This role will be part of a team that focuses on supporting CNN’s core Original Series & Films (such as Searching for Italy with Stanley Tucci and 3 Identical Strangers), program development, talent research, and non-linear measurement (Video-On-Demand & Subscription Platforms). The analyst will support regular reporting of the networks’ linear performance and forecasting.
The Daily
Develop an understanding of the media landscape, content research, and non-fiction programming
Provide support and recommendations (with manager oversight) to the program development teams
Produce non-fiction reporting including detailed week-by-week program trackers
Assist manager and co-analyst in ad-hoc analysis and deep dive investigations
Support non-linear measurement (Video-On-Demand and Subscription Platforms) and content performance
Maintain competitive non-fiction reporting such as HBO tracking
Assist manager in long-term quarterly talent measurement and reporting
Support larger team in long-range CNN estimates and forecasting
Assist in production of daily and regular reporting needs for the CNN and HLN brands, as well as competitive networks
Learn how to extract and analyze industry data using secondary software applications (Ex: Nielsen Npower) as well as internal tools (Ex. Tableau dashboard)
The Essentials
Bachelor’s degree required. Mathematics, finance, media, research, marketing, or business focus preferred
Minimum of 1-2 years of relevant work experience in Data Analysis, Media Research, Media Buying/Planning, Market Research
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Power Point, Excel, Outlook, and Word). You must be able to use Pivot Tables, Excel analysis formulas (IF, VLOOKUP, COUNT, SUMIF, SUMPRODUCT, etc.) and formatting data, create and edit charts in Excel. Tableau or Domo knowledge a plus
Strong analytical skills - ability to collect, organize, and analyze data with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy, and transform into meaningful, actionable information
Knowledge and a strong interest in TV and/or SVOD non-fiction programming and content

Apple is in search of an experienced Digital Advertising Data Analyst to join the Services Digital Advertising team. You will work on the Paid Digital Media Strategy team under the Digital Advertising Analytics Lead to compile cross-channel reporting data, as well as communicate key insights, offering recommendations to stakeholders.

Title: Analyst, Valuation Insights

Location: US - Remote

Reports to Title: Senior Manager, Valuation Insights – Valuation Services


The Role:

As part of the Valuation Services division of J.D. Power, you will work to understand what factors contribute to future values of vehicles. The Valuation Insights Analyst will be responsible for supporting the residual value output of ALG's bi-monthly forecasts. Responsibilities include analyzing vehicle data provided by OEMs and third-party sources to evaluate vehicle builds and audit residual value forecasts. Your interest in the automotive space will greatly enhance our Valuation Insights team with perspectives about the industry, products, vehicle lifecycle, content developments, and trends.


The Impact:

The Valuation Insights team is responsible for the residual valuation of vehicles in the US and Canadian market. Automakers and lenders use our guidance to determine sales planning and leasing programs.


Responsibilities:

Analyze complex data sets to develop residual value positioning for all vehicles in US and Canadian markets
Provide insightful findings and recommendations for valuation forecast adjustments
Analyze vehicle specifications and calculate impacts of pricing and content on future residual values
Evaluate current and future trends of new products, technology as well as market developments and competition
Coordinate client deliverables and deadlines with the Industry Solutions team
Actively participate and lead internal and external meetings related to residual forecast
Work cross-functionally with the Data Science team and other key functions to ensure latest analytics are incorporated in output


Qualifications:

At least 3 – 5 years of relevant work experience
Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Finance or similar field
Excellent critical thinking, data analysis and communication (written and verbal) skills necessary
Must be a proactive problem solver and able to handle complex projects and tasks
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Prioritization and time management skills essential
Expert proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of products
Desire to learn about the automotive industry and all factors impacting used vehicle prices


The Career Opportunity:

In this role, you will grow your knowledge of the automotive space while working with new and interesting data sets. Over time, you will play an important role educating automakers and lenders on the factors impacting residual values.


The Team / The Business:

The Valuation Insights team members have a passion for the automotive industry and have individual strengths that contribute to a strong and collaborative team.


Our Hiring Manager says:

"If being part of a collaborative, high-performing team who shares an interest in data and cars sounds like a good fit for you, this may be the opportunity you've been looking for"

Data Analyst I
 - (3156217)
Description:
The Mongan Institute at Massachusetts General Hospital is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to support research at the Mongan Institute. The Data Analyst will work with investigators on externally funded research studies that focus that range from observational large data set analyses to longitudinal intervention and implementation research studies. The Mongan Institute is an innovative transdisciplinary research institute at MGH consisting of 13 centers and programs spanning data science to delivery science with over 115 faculty, over 30 research fellows, as well as medical student and undergraduate trainees (for details see https://www.monganinstitute.org/).

Working under the supervision of faculty biostatisticians in the Biostatistics and Data Science Unit at the Mongan Institute, the Data Analyst will work collaboratively with investigators, including health services researchers, clinicians, and biostatisticians. The Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring data integrity; analyzing data; conducting valid statistical tests and statistical models; and assisting with data visualization and communicating findings in presentations and manuscripts. A specific focus of this position is to provide data analytic support to junior investigators within the Mongan Institute.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
The Data Analyst will oversee data analyses and will be responsible for setting up data management platforms and ensuring the quality of the data. The Data Analyst will ensure accuracy of the data, accounting for missing data and addressing data structure to best inform analyses. The Data Analyst will work with observational and newly collected intervention and implementation research data to create longitudinal datasets to assure quality and answer key questions for investigators including analyses of cross-sectional data, as well as creating longitudinal cohorts that will be analyzed over time; and conducting valid statistical tests and advanced modeling. The Data Analyst will work on a variety of data-focused tasks including, but not limited to data cleaning, data harmonization, and data analysis and interpretation (e.g. multivariate regression analyses, survival analyses, etc.). In addition, the Data Analyst will generate data reports and analysis as needed to inform project planning. The Analyst will also create programs for analysis, and participate in manuscript development.
Bachelor’s degree required in statistics, biostatistics, public health or other related social science field with strong quantitative emphasis (Master’s preferred).
Strong skills in data management including developing a process for merging and reconciling data from different sources and with different characteristics.
Experience in data management and statistical analysis in a research setting preferred.
Intermediate experience with statistical analysis.
Familiarity with SAS preferred as well as experience with R, Python, or similar programming languages.
Facility in computer programs used for data entry such as SPSS, Excel or Access.
Strong programming skills.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to function well as a member of a team.
This position requires the ability to work simultaneously on various tasks with different investigators, while maintaining attention to detail, and to effectively work with supervising faculty biostatisticians.

EEO Statement
Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.

Leverage Datto technology and process knowledge to make recommendations
Identify trends within our continuity product data from purchasing trends, device utilization, error logs, and technical support data

Bachelor's degree and 2+ years of relevant experience
Advanced SQL and Excel knowledge
Intermediate Tableau experience (or similar software)
Ability to implement statistical analysis/modeling through Python (or SPSS/R/etc.)
Previous experience working with ElasticSearch data preferred
Expertise in analyzing and packaging large amounts of data into actionable research reports
Advanced analytical/problem solving and research skills
Effective communication skills for writing reports/proposals and supporting presentations

THE POSITION
Looking for a rewarding job making a difference in the lives of children? Join the Office of Children, Youth and Families team! As a member of our team, you’ll be part of a diverse network that supports and strengthens families in Pennsylvania to provide safe, nurturing and healthy environments for children. The work is challenging, but extremely rewarding! There are opportunities for professional development and growth AND free parking!
DESCRIPTION OF WORK
This position is part of the Systems and Data Management Section within the Bureau of Policy, Programs and Operations, and is part of a team of Business Analysts responsible for supporting the program offices in the planning, development, implementation and operation of information systems for the programs administered and supervised by OCYF.

The Systems and Data Management Section manages the existing Child Welfare Information Solution (CWIS) and is responsible for providing leadership and direction for the planning, development and implementation of a new Statewide Child Welfare Case Management System. The Section also manages other legacy applications for the office and is responsible for data management, data quality, and reporting.

The person in this position will perform analysis of county and/or state business processes and requirements that will be supported in a new case management system. Additional job duties are to include engaging users in business process reengineering and user stories, participating in the design and development of the case management system, performing user acceptance testing, and providing implementation support (training and technical assistance).

A portion of the person’s time may also include providing child welfare and OCYF procedural expertise for operational support and technical assistance for the following systems and processes: DocuShare, Account Administration (Business Partner account/technical assistance), Continuity of Operations, CWIS (Child Welfare Information System), and management of the CWIS County Helpdesk Resource Account.

The work also involves representing the program office and providing child welfare expertise in the identification and documentation of existing business processes, and in the development and implementation of improved business processes for their application to an IT system in support of agency programs and policy.

Work Hours and Additional Information:
Full time employment.
Work hours: 8:00 am - 4:30 pm, Monday - Friday with 1 hour lunch.
You will have the opportunity to work from home (telework), part-time up to 4 days a week. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY
Qualifications:
Minimum Experience and Training Requirements - One year as a Business Analyst 1; OR one year as an Information Technology Trainee; OR one year of business process analysis experience and a bachelor’s degree; OR five years of business process analysis experience; OR an equivalent combination of experience and training.
Must meet PA residency requirement – For more information on ways to meet PA residency requirements, follow the link and click on Residency.
Do not submit resumes, cover letters, and similar documents. These documents will not be reviewed and the information contained therein will not be considered for the purposes of determining your eligibility for the position or to determine your score. Information to support your eligibility for the position must be provided on the application (i.e., relevant, detailed experience/education).
If you are claiming education in your answers to the supplemental application questions, you must attach a copy of your college transcripts for your claim to be accepted toward meeting the minimum requirements. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable.
Must be able to perform essential job functions.

About Us:
At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.

Job Summary:
The SM-3 IIA Finance Team is looking for a collaborative and detail-oriented Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) lead. In this role, you will be responsible for providing financial leadership in analyzing and reporting booking, sales, profit, and cash for the SM-3 IIA Portfolio, including both Production and Development programs. You will partner with the Senior Director overseeing SM-3 IIA as well as with 15+ Program Managers, program finance analysts, and cross functional team. You will be responsible for ensuring weekly updates to BSEC, monthly updates to forecast and balance sheet (such as unbilled, backlog, billing, etc) are complete, along with other FP&A deliverables such as Annual Operating Plan (AOP), 5 year, including all reviews and updates to internal systems. You will also be responsible for improving current processes and procedures for FP&A and providing on-going financial training for the program team.

There’s no such thing as a perfect candidate, so don’t hold back. Your qualifications could add tremendous value to our team. Our customers come from all different backgrounds, and so do our employees. If you’re passionate about what you could accomplish here, we’d love to hear from you.

Responsibilities to Anticipate:
Analyzing and managing bookings, sales, profit and cash.
Ensuring weekly updates to BSEC, monthly updates to forecast and balance sheet (such as unbilled, backlog, billing, etc) are complete, along with other FP&A deliverables such as Annual Operating Plan (AOP), 5 year, including all reviews and updates to internal systems.
Improving current processes and procedures for FP&A and providing on-going financial training for the program team.
An advanced degree in a related field may be substituted for additional years of experience as follows: Master's is equal to 2 years of experience.

Qualifications You Must Have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics or related
5 Years of professional experience in a related finance role
Excellent computer skills experience, which include a high level of proficiency with advanced Microsoft Excel functions (Pivot Tables, Lookups, Macros, etc.).
Experience with SAP (APEX, PRISM, Rplan, and Analysis for Office reporting or similar)
Qualifications We Value:
Good written and verbal skills including a demonstrated ability to succinctly present complex information to all levels of organization.
Ability to interact with and impact team members at every level of the Finance and functional organizations
Deep critical thinking and problem solving skills, including the ability to prioritize concurrent requirements and accommodate numerous stakeholders.
Shows initiative by seeking ways to expand on existing practices and improve processes and data analysis.
Deep desire to learn and contribute in a dynamic and highly collaborative team-based environment.
Ability to work under general direction and actively participate in determining objectives of assignments.
Understanding of Raytheon financial and accounting policies and procedures.

What We Offer:
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the excellent benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.

About Ipsos

Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.


Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD).

ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com


About Our Analyst Development Program

The Analyst Development Program is our entry-level learning and development program. As part of the program you will gain the foundation for a successful Market Research career. We offer a structured training program, including both classroom and on-the-job training, providing the knowledge and skills necessary. Through our rotational track you will explore multiple areas of research specialization within Ipsos, establishing yourself as a versatile researcher and building your network within our organization before graduating into one of our specializations.


About the Role

Do you love a good mystery? Feel compelled to seek out the true meaning of things?


Would you like to work with a team of passionate problem-solvers dedicated to bringing research insights and compelling data to life?


If all this sounds good so far, you could be just the person we’re looking for!


Our Research Analysts are critical members of our team. As a Research Analyst in the program, you’ll get a chance to work with some of the world’s most recognized brands and companies, helping to solve their biggest challenges.


Think this might be the right opportunity for you?
Our most successful Research Analysts are:

Driven and highly motivated
Exceptionally responsible and productive
Insanely detail-oriented
Progress-obsessed individuals
Analytical minded
Eager to learn
Comfortable stepping out of their comfort zone
Empathetic towards clients and colleagues
Curious and display interest in the business
Team players


The Research Analyst is a diverse role ideal for someone ready to:

Develop a deep understanding of what drives consumer behavior, gathering opinions, usage and interests through survey research, to support our clients’ decision making
Learn to expertly manage and facilitate all phases of a market research study
Design surveys that address the client’s business questions
Manage project timelines, ensuring that all milestones are met
Work closely with colleagues in our operations groups to oversee all operational components of projects
Perform quality checks at various stages of the research to ensure accuracy
Analyze and interpret survey results
Support the preparation of reports and presentations


Don’t wait! Apply for the 2022 position today if you:

Are awesome!
Love consumer decision-making and puzzles
Get excited about what makes customers happy
Have an inquisitive nature and are intellectually curious about the world around them
Have strong organizational and time management skills
Have eagle-eye attention to detail
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enjoy a fast-paced, agile working environment
Are humble. You recognize you have a lot to learn and value learning from the ground up
Are a team player. You enjoy working with others and being part of a collaborative environment
Have a background and/or familiarity with quantitative and/or qualitative research methodologies
Have serious Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Have a Bachelor’s degree


About Ipsos’ Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’s diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.


We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.


Share our passion. Share our success. Join us in being an #IpsosGameChanger.


Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Overview:

SMBC Capital Markets, Inc. (CM) is a derivatives trading company which was started in 1988 and is based in New York City, with offices in London and Hong Kong. SMBC CM is an established derivatives dealer with a broad product portfolio, with specific emphasis on interest rates and foreign exchange products such as interest & FX swaps, FRAs, options, exotic products, commodity derivatives as well as exchange traded products such as treasury bonds, interest rate futures & options, currency futures, treasury futures & options, etc.
This is a position for a junior level quantitative analyst. The focus is identifying, researching, and implementing better approaches to automated trading in the area of interest rates derivatives, including inflation and foreign exchange.
The role resides in our Capital Markets Front Office team and provides quantitative support in terms of model research, implementation, application building. The candidate will work very closely with traders, quant developers and desk quants.
Responsibilities:
Analyst level front office electronic trading quant who will contribute to DPG's electronic trading effort in interest rate and FX products.
Produce, maintain and extend trading model implementations built in Java/ Python.
Implement risk reports and processes automation for risk management purposed purpose.
Creating test environment and test case for trading model management, model control and regulation auditing purpose.
Qualifications:
Masters or PhD Degree in Finance or a Quantitative Field of Science or Engineering. Bachelor Degree candidates will be considered if you demonstrate strong skills in Math and programming languages.
Solid background in Applied Mathematics in understanding of stochastic calculus, statistics and time series analysis.
Solid programming skill in Java/ Python or other complied language. Working knowledge of either Microsoft or Linux development environment.
Knowledge of scripting language, Linux is a plus.

SUMMARY

GCM Grosvenor is seeking a Quantitative Analyst to join its Investments team. This Investment team is a group within GCM Grosvenor that invests across asset classes, security types, industries and regions and maintains the flexibility to implement investments both directly and alongside third-party partners.


The Quantitative Analyst will be involved in analytic projects to aid the investment process across hedge fund and private equity style investing. The Quantitative Analyst will be collaborating with various teams within the firm including Investments, Research, Risk and Technology.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The individual will be involved in the following critical activities:

Assess new investment strategies and monitor current conditions within existing strategies utilized by the firm.
Track, analyze, and interpret trends in specific strategies and the related capital markets.
Develop and utilize quantitative risk analytics and models for manager assessment and fund management using a test driven development methodology. Contribute to the development and maintenance of the quantitative technology platform.
Design, develop and produce intuitive and responsive data visualization reports and dashboards.
Investigate portfolios and strategies to develop data-driven, in-depth comprehension of investment processes, risk profiles, portfolio construction, and investor behavior.
Identify and manage new datasets that support investment decisions and risk management processes.
Collaborate on projects with investment team members aimed at generating new insight and solutions to improve investment strategy.


EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

The ideal experience and critical competencies for the role include the following:

A Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Financial Engineering, Statistics/Econometrics or equivalent quantitative financial and/or technical skills.
2-7 years' experience in quantitative analysis, portfolio construction, and/or risk management role(s) requiring commercial problem solving and the application of quantitative finance, statistics/econometrics.
Prior experience in financial services and/or investment management is required.
Interest in or knowledge of the financial markets and investment industry.
Initiative and ability to operate at a high level in a less structured, entrepreneurial team environment.
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, changing environment.
A commitment to the highest ethical standards and to act with professionalism and integrity.
Excellent written and verbal skills; specifically, the ability to articulate clearly and communicate effectively with professionals across the firm.
Dedicated work ethic and commitment to a team and a goal-oriented environment.

In terms of cultural fit, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and energized by working amongst a group of thoughtful, smart and successful colleagues. He or she will enjoy being part of an organization focused on excellence and will be a naturally collaborative person who enjoys interacting with individuals at all levels. Additionally, he or she will be a strong team player with a proactive approach and the ability to exercise discretion and judgment.


ABOUT THE FIRM

GCM Grosvenor (NASDAQ: GCMG) is a global alternatives investment firm with approximately $68 billion in assets under management in private equity, infrastructure, real estate, credit, absolute return strategies, and multi-asset class opportunistic investments. We have specialized in alternatives since 1971, and we are dedicated to unlocking value for our clients by leveraging our cross-asset class and flexible investment platform.


Our experienced team of approximately 500 professionals from diverse backgrounds serves a global client base of institutional and high net worth investors. GCM Grosvenor is headquartered in Chicago, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Seoul.


A diverse, engaged team is critical to our ability to successfully create and deliver value to our clients. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where diverse professionals can thrive professionally, and we are dedicated to training, retaining and promoting minorities, women, LGBTQ employees, veterans and individuals with disabilities. 57% of GCM Grosvenor employees and 40% of executive management are women and/or ethnically diverse individuals. In addition, we seek to drive a more diverse, inclusive industry through our partnership with diverse professionals organizations and by consciously working with subcontractors and vendors that are certified as minority-, women-, or persons with disabilities-owned businesses


For more information, visit www.gcmgrosvenor.com.

However, the initial offer is for 10 hours/week for two weeks only. Class Definition
This position is responsible for data analysis, validation and correction to support retirement processing, accurate benefit payments, and member communication regarding retirement data. This position is responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely reporting of member data to the Employees’ Retirement System of Rhode Island by employers. The Data Analyst is responsible for extracting information and data for use by the actuary, to support Public Records Act requests, and other integral processes of the Employees’ Retirement System of Rhode Island (ERSRI) regarding all information relating to a member’s rights and benefits.

To professionally, courteously and respectfully treat all contacts with customers of the General Treasurer’s Office including the public, other government agencies, the business community, fellow employees and any other customers, both in person and when answering incoming calls, emails, letters and any other form of contact, and to project a customer-friendly attitude committed to provide high quality customer service.

To perform duties as directed to support the operations of the General Treasurer’s Office during times of increased departmental workloads, including but not limited to working on a temporary basis (not to exceed 3 months, which may be extended by mutual agreement) in the Crime Victim Compensation Program, General Administration, Business Processing, Employees’ Retirement, Unclaimed Property and/or the Investment Division. Designated managers within each division will review work for conformance to established procedures and regulations. Employees will not be disciplined for their inability to meet job requirements which are specific to a position to which they are temporarily transferred. Experience, including working in other departments, may be considered as a factor in selecting employees for promotions and/or transfers to new positions.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Works under the supervision of the Special Projects Manager and Deputy Director who review work for conformance to established procedures and regulations.

SUPERVISION EXERCISED: None
Illustrative Examples of Work Performed
To analyze incoming data in the wage and contribution process and recommend control procedures.
To generate and prepare ad hoc reports from the Pension Administration Software System (Ariel 360) and other data systems.
To work with participating employers to resolve any potential discrepancies in census data that is posted to the Ariel database.
To develop and maintain a data analysis plan for identifying potential data anomalies or errors; and to ensure data quality.
To analyze discrepancies and develop queries within the applicable system to prepare corrections as required.
To collaborate with local plan municipalities and the State’s Department of Information Technology (DOIT) as necessary to ensure accurate and timely wage and contribution reporting.To ensure accuracy of and validate service credit and contributions of member files.
To conduct training sessions for other Member Services Staff on aspects of system functionality.
To assist in the division’s outreach and seminar programs for employers.
To work with all state, school and municipal personnel/payroll offices regarding salary certification, service credit information and any other information that is needed from these agencies for completion of related tasks.
To provide technical support for actuarial reporting of demographics and data reconciliation for the annual valuation.
To Serve as technical liaison between computer vendors and/or offsite system maintenance providers and ERSRI on all functionalities.
To assist the Chief Financial Officer in coordinating the semi-annual IT audit and implementing any potential recommendations.
To Assist in the development and management of the IT security policies, the IT governance and strategic plan, including the generation and review of audit and activity reports.
To conduct full lifecycle activities of data analytics to include requirements and design, data cleaning, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, linking databases and datasets, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements in models.
To ensure the integrity of project data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing, and analysis.
To query and interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
To provide data visualization and presentation of analytical findings to program owners and other stakeholders.
To identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets.
To link databases and datasets to generate integrated datasets.
To support the processing of accurate and timely calculations related to pension benefits as needed in the Pension Administration Software System. Such calculations may include calculations for benefits such as: pension payments, purchasing of optional service credit, estimated benefit payments, death and survivor benefits, QDRO’s, disability benefits and benefit adjustments.
To process manual calculations on occasion as requested by the Director of Member Services.
To identify and define new process improvement opportunities.
To do related work as required.

Required Qualifications for Appointment
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, CAPACITIES: Must be detail-oriented and possess excellent quantitative and analytical abilities. Must have a thorough working knowledge of spreadsheet applications and related capacities and abilities.

Must have a working knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of data processing and automated systems; knowledge and understanding of retirement systems, specifically defined benefit plans, is preferable.

Must possess a working knowledge of SQL query analyzer or comparable tools and be able to write scripts and query data based on a server.

Must demonstrate a strong proficiency in, but not limited to, the Microsoft Office products (especially Access, Excel and Word).

Must have experience in extracting, analyzing, validating and summarizing data for ad hoc projects assigned by management.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENT: Must have reliable transportation to assist in retirement outreach and seminar programs.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Must have a degree from a 4-year college with a concentration in computer science, accounting, business administration, or related field.

Seven (7) years of experience in a retirement system operation involving benefit and/or data analysis.

Or, any combination of education and experience that shall be substantially equivalent to the above education and experience.

If an applicant is unable to perform any essential job function because of his/her disability but can achieve the required results by means of a REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION, then the individual shall not be considered unqualified for the position.

Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84112 (East Bench area)
Description:
About Ipsos

Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.


Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD).

ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com


About Our Analyst Development Program

The Analyst Development Program is our entry-level learning and development program. As part of the program you will gain the foundation for a successful Market Research career. We offer a structured training program, including both classroom and on-the-job training, providing the knowledge and skills necessary. Through our rotational track you will explore multiple areas of research specialization within Ipsos, establishing yourself as a versatile researcher and building your network within our organization before graduating into one of our specializations.


About the Role

Do you love a good mystery? Feel compelled to seek out the true meaning of things?


Would you like to work with a team of passionate problem-solvers dedicated to bringing research insights and compelling data to life?


If all this sounds good so far, you could be just the person we’re looking for!


Our Research Analysts are critical members of our team. As a Research Analyst in the program, you’ll get a chance to work with some of the world’s most recognized brands and companies, helping to solve their biggest challenges.


Think this might be the right opportunity for you?
Our most successful Research Analysts are:

Driven and highly motivated
Exceptionally responsible and productive
Insanely detail-oriented
Progress-obsessed individuals
Analytical minded
Eager to learn
Comfortable stepping out of their comfort zone
Empathetic towards clients and colleagues
Curious and display interest in the business
Team players


The Research Analyst is a diverse role ideal for someone ready to:

Develop a deep understanding of what drives consumer behavior, gathering opinions, usage and interests through survey research, to support our clients’ decision making
Learn to expertly manage and facilitate all phases of a market research study
Design surveys that address the client’s business questions
Manage project timelines, ensuring that all milestones are met
Work closely with colleagues in our operations groups to oversee all operational components of projects
Perform quality checks at various stages of the research to ensure accuracy
Analyze and interpret survey results
Support the preparation of reports and presentations


Don’t wait! Apply for the 2022 position today if you:

Are awesome!
Love consumer decision-making and puzzles
Get excited about what makes customers happy
Have an inquisitive nature and are intellectually curious about the world around them
Have strong organizational and time management skills
Have eagle-eye attention to detail
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enjoy a fast-paced, agile working environment
Are humble. You recognize you have a lot to learn and value learning from the ground up
Are a team player. You enjoy working with others and being part of a collaborative environment
Have a background and/or familiarity with quantitative and/or qualitative research methodologies
Have serious Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Have a Bachelor’s degree


About Ipsos’ Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’s diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.


We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.


Share our passion. Share our success. Join us in being an #IpsosGameChanger.


Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.


#LI-KH1
Required Skills

Required Experience

Come join a growing, dynamic, and innovative fintech team that is fast becoming a market leader in Procurement-as-a-Service solutions. Concertiv works with a global, blue-chip client base in financial services and other verticals to enable frictionless purchasing of the best products at the best prices. With a combination of adaptive software, great people, and a proven methodology, Concertiv partners with clients to seamlessly integrate into vital workflows, enabling group purchasing and specialized programs across key operating categories. Concertiv’s solution allows clients to reduce costs, increase productivity, reduce risk, and execute strategic business decisions. For more information visit us at: www.concertiv.com.OverviewReporting to the Senior Vice President of Client Services, the Market Data Senior Analyst is a key role in delivering our market data and information services portfolio management solution to clients in investment banking, private equity, and asset management. These data services enable Concertiv clients to complete critical day-to-day tasks from deal sourcing and origination to closure. As a Market Data Senior Analyst, you would be responsible for managing client subscriptions, advising on the procurement of new data services, negotiating with vendors, and ensuring our clients’ employees have the proper workbench of data services required for their jobs.This is a hands-on role, offering broad exposure to project management, negotiation tactics, and financial services operations in a highly entrepreneurial environment. While there is a substantial analytical component to the position, it is also very much about ‘doing’ and rapidly implementing ideas, including producing client-ready presentations and executing the details of data-driven projects. This is a client-facing and vendor-facing role.A high degree of discretion is required, as you will frequently handle sensitive and confidential information within elite financial services institutions.What you’ll do:Negotiate hundreds of data subscriptions for clientsSource and recommend best-in-class research, data, and technology products to financial services clientsAnalyze business cases, cost projections, and vendor proposalsLead client check-in calls with senior executives (CFOs, COOs, and GCs)Troubleshoot common subscription issues, including licensing problems and invoice verificationGenerate internal and external reports to track Concertiv customer service wins and negotiating successCreate market data vendor landscapes to help clients assess product valuesDemo & collect client feedback on Concertiv technology stackSkills and experience:Familiarity with data and research products is a plus2+ years of experience negotiating subscription agreements as either a buyer or sellerAbility to speak authoritatively to client stakeholders including the C-SuiteBasic math, data manipulation, and formatting skills to create client-facing work in Excel and PowerPoint; you don’t need to be an artist, but we don’t have a design team!Effective written communication via email, presentations, and (down the road) white papers/industry analysisAbility to balance simultaneous negotiations across multiple clients; calm under pressureWho will love this job:A competitor: you are motivated to deliver wins on behalf of clientsA team player: you know when to collaborate and when to execute soloA problem solver: you ask the right questions and drive towards solutions with exceptional attention to detailA builder: you will develop our infrastructure, playbook, and process to support our growthBenefitsCompetitive compensation and upside potentialGround floor opportunity to shape the strategic direction of an industry-disrupting businessExposure to business leaders across finance, law, consulting, and technologySharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environmentA fun work environment with a flexible vacation policyAbout ConcertivConcertiv is a procurement-as-a-service platform that provides data analytics, group purchasing, and managed services to professional services firms and their key suppliers. While we currently focus on Market Data, Information Technology, Insurance, and Travel, we are opportunistic about finding additional ways to serve our customers. Our goal is to facilitate Buyer | Seller interactions in these categories by removing friction, opacity, and frustration.Our team is hard-working, tight-knit, and creative. We emphasize collaboration, personal accountability, and kindness. We are committed to professional development, as we know that our success hinges on not only hiring top talent but also retaining that talent. We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.Come join us!‍Job Type: Full-timePay: $42,013.00 - $111,101.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication Question(s):Please provide LinkedIn linkWork Location:Multiple locationsWork Remotely:YesWork Location: Multiple Locations
